Reviews.Title: “barely a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: barry c
Reviews.Content: Its always best to try and start on a positive a believe. The hotel is very well positioned and it has a pool that does help at the hottest part of the day.The hotel itself is in desperate need of a referbishment and modernisation. In the UK it would struggle to achieve a 3 star status the rooms are so shoddy. If you decide to book beware of booking bed and breakfast because if you require something unuual such as EGGS! you need to pay extra! In short the hotel is tired far from luxurious and the breakfast is an exercise in hidden costs.I am sure the fine city of Madris can offer better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Brill stay - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Greendoor09
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel - spacious room, comfortable beds and luxurious bed linen. Very clean and price good if you can get a deal . Great location. Roof top garden and pool excellent -makes a city break into a more relaxing holiday. We found staff quite friendly. Only negative was cost of wifi - I think it was 12 euro a day! In such a quality hotel this is an old fashioned approach and it should be free. Think about it Emporador management! For this reason I would rate 4.5 rather than 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but trying to get more money out of you leaves a bad taste.”
Reviews.Author: Sianarealla
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms both with three beds, with five girls travelling its nice to have the extra space. When we got to the hotel they told us we could have a three bed and a two bed room, we asked for a refund towards on one of the rooms as we had paid for a three bed. All of a sudden a room with the three beds became available. The rooms ‘view’ was spoilt by scaffolding, and we had to have the curtains closed the whole trip as there were male builders on the scaffolding. All was fine until we checked out. They handed us a bill and said we needed to pay an extra 100 Euros for the extra bed. We explained we had already paid for the bed and the man at the desk (who claimed he booked us in – he hadn’t a women had) said we hadn’t paid for the extra bed at all, we asked why the rooms were the same price and we refused to pay the extra charge. They kept shouting at us in Spanish. It too half an hour to sort out – the only reason they agreed to take the money off is because they didn’t want us to talk to the manager. They also tried to charge us for room and pool service that we didn’t order. The hotel is in a great location, great transport links and having a pool in the city centre is a lovely bonus. But them trying to over charge us and get more money out of us for something we had already paid for! And while a pool is lovely, one full for bird feathers and bugs isn't!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Colleen767
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the outdoor pool and central location both of which are fantastic. It is right in the heart of Madrid and within walking distance of most things to see. But also has Bus, Metro, Taxis and shops right outside the door. The hotel common areas, like lobby, bar etc. are very nice and you feel you are in a 4/5 star hotel. Staff are pleasant and helpful. However our actual room no. 314 (standard double) was a bit dark (window looking at concrete walls of the hotel itself - no sunlight) and compact. Basic bed with basic bedding. The ensuite bathroom was good though - nice towels and toiletries supplied and the house-keeping was excellent. According to reports, this hotel was refurbished in 2006 but our room was more 1980!. We were fine with it because we got a very good rate from Roomex. However, if we had paid full price we would have been disappointed and would have asked for a change of room. Our rate included cold buffet breakfast and this was ample. For extra supplement there was hot breakfast which we tried and this was eggs cooked to your liking/omelette, rubbery sausage, leathery bacon, mixed veg broccoli, green beans etc. and savoury rice not great. We enjoyed our stay here mainly due to the rooftop pool facility, central city location and its overall ambience....... and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Still as good!”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled800
Reviews.Content: Went on a 'girlie' weekend away and stayed at this hotel. It was wonderful. Had booked club rooms and this entitled us to free drinks in the club lounge. Although the drinks choice available was very limited (no wine), we coped! Hotel is very central. On main road near to all shops and restaurants. Taxis outside door. Tour bus across road. It has a roof top swimming pool and sun loungers. The bar area is lovely. The reception staff are very helpful. Couldn't've wished for a nicer place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Roof Top Pool is Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: lbrin
Reviews.Content: We were first put in a terrible room and i went to reception and this was changed to a 1st floor room - there was no natural sunlight in the room however we didnt mind as we was only in the room to sleep! we loved the rooftop pool and the food up there was amazing as well - the service was good - overall am pleased we stayed there

Reviews.Title: “5* Service”
Reviews.Author: dieselbloke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days from 27- 31st August - it is without a doubt one of the best hotels in Madrid. For a number of reasons; 1. The reception staff: a very slick and efficient customer facing team - personable, friendly and helpful, in particular the female with the curly hair and older gentleman with spectacles. They helped me without any hesitation on a number of occasions. 2. The rooms: i got exactly what i requested - a street facing room with a balcony (If you don’t ask you don't get). The room was perfect, large double with double glazed doors to keep out the street noise. This is not a modern styled hotel and the furnishings/decoration are classic (chandleries & teak furniture) - which adds to an atmosphere of old fashioned grandeur! & spotlessly clean! 3. The pool: must be the biggest hotel sundeck in Madrid – the pool is clean and large, the whole rooftop area is again well managed – the staff all very welcoming and helpful and the restaurant service fast. And what a view! 4. Location: Gran Via runs through the heart of Madrid, where else could be more accessible. Metro and buses on your doorstep and everything worth seeing within a 15/20 min walk! I’ve stayed in quite a few 5 star hotels in Madrid – they don’t compare. The Emperador knocks spots off them on every count in my opinion. Thank you for a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awful room, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: run_ski_alski
Reviews.Content: The location was very central.The hotel was clean and basic, but my room was tiny - barely space to walk either side of the bed - with a view of a service yard and wall. Very disappointing as I had paid for a 'double' room. I was told as I had a double bed, this constituted a double. The rooftop pool is the only reason to stay here, and even that is a little shabby.

Reviews.Title: “pool made the difference”
Reviews.Author: seeworld200
Reviews.Content: hotel very central, rooms average nothing special pool great but closed quite early didnt eat at the hotel but lots of bars and eating places very close would recommend and would probably use if staying in madrid again and would consider to upgrade to a superior room next time

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good central location”
Reviews.Author: Tommy R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last september 2011 with my wife. Madrid is a great city and this hotel is in a great location close to most of the sights with a number of underground stations very close to this hotel,you can travel all over the city very easily on the undergroud.Hotel is very clean,rooms are a good size kept very clean,our room was out back of hotel so was very dark overlooking a garden and other rooms. Better to ask for room out front with a view of city.We booked this hotel mainly cause of the rooftop pool and bar which was great , it was nice to be able to have a swim in the pool on those warm days.We didn't really eat or drink in the hotel as taught it was a bit expensive ( just the odd snack and drink at the pool bar ) So really can't comment on the bar or restaurant.But plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance from hotel to suit everyone's liking.Would probably stay here again mainly cause of location and rooftop pool and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Eggo1
Reviews.Content: Location is good for walking to the Palace and the areas with many bars and restaurants. Upon booking we were advised a room with a view was available upon request. Although we emailed the hotel we received not reply and no view :( The room we was very dark even during the day as we looked out onto another building that was quite close. Pool terrace is good, especially when hot in the city, but watch out the pool itself is freezing even when it has been 40degrees all day ! We had an adjoining room and the neighbours were in bed early, they often banged on the door if we watched the television when relaxing upon return to our room after a busy day ! A bit annoying ! I would say overall more a 3 star hotel, I guess they get the 4 stars due to the outdoor pool and terrace! Overall a good hotel, clean and in the heart of the city, the staff on reception could give a warmer welcome upon arrival and when approaching them for information.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good”
Reviews.Author: nicola m
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this Hotel for a few days with Family. It was actually really hot weather-so the rooftop pool was ideal! So glad we booked a hotel with a pool- which is a must with a young child. The rooms had a little balcony- which I enjoyed-could sit out at night and watch the world go by! The Madrilenos are pretty much Night Owls! we found that they would come out of the cinema about 10.30-11pm and sit with their family and have a meal- which we loved- as they obviously feel safe. We encountered friendly people in this city. The hotel was spotlessly clean- the rooms cleaned well each day, there is a hairdryer and toiletries and fresh towels each day. Could not fault the cleanliness.The lift is really small-and always have to wait ages so use the stairs if you can!The buffet breakfast is great- lots of choice but we think you have to pay extra for cooked omelettes or bacon. Something to do with a voucher- not sure as we never wanted cooked food- there is fruit,yoghurts, meats, cheeses, toast, muffins and cereals - we found a deal with breakfast included in the price- otherwise at 19 euros- quite expensive I think! Also not sure what was going on with the cava - we had some bucks fizz type drink one morning then it was never opened after that! Not sure whether they also charged extra for this! At the pool there is hot food and the food was lovely- really recommend. Except for the fact we found a small orange "top" in the salad- not sure what it was off- but we did complain and the staff apologised. However when reported to management no response! That is not good- luckily no one choked on it! But apart from that excellent food if a bit pricey! The drinks at the pool are also expensive- and although no-one is supposed to take food or drinks up there- we found loads of people were taking bottles of water- just be discreet. We think there should have been free water and also waiter service around the pool- but they seem understaffed at times- so maybe that its the reason- but it would have been so much better !! There are showers and a dressing room as well- and also supply towels. A definite plus to choosing the hotel! The Hotel is very central for everywhere as well- and lots of restaurants nearby. Also noticed some of the reviews were moaning about the noise- we found it fine- and we were on the first floor- it is a little noisy if you leave doors of balcony open but there is air con which is great and so you can shut out the noise. After all it is in a busy street. But we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: InBigSmoke
Reviews.Content: Went to The Emperador Hotel on a Groupon deal with Easyjet; our 2nd trip as a couple to Madrid and it won't be our last, we love it! The Emperador is a lovely hotel, a little way out from the main tourist hussle and bussle - we were still able to walk in to the main squares and restaurants, but if that's too far it's only 2 mins from the nearest 2 Metro's. It is on a main road which I can imagine if you are in a room front facing on a lower floor it would be a little noisy from commuter traffic; but why would you still be in bed at that time? The rooms are good, the breakfast is lovely, pricey if not included though. But the best bit is the roof top pool, with lovely views and perfect for cooling off after a long day sight seeing and tapas! Drinks service on the roof a little slow, but when in Spain.....

Reviews.Title: “A least 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: theadviso
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling for almost a month now. I've been to portugal, morroco, france and spain. I've been in about 10 hotels and this is one of the best. I'm not talking only about his rooms and lobby, pool and cleanliness which are great by the way but about his staff and their great attitude because while I was walking in madrid's street I've been robbed, they took my wallet with my credit card and room key (card)and instead of complaining and making me pay for the key the helped me deactivate my credit card and kindly offered me two new keys and insisted on not charging me so I personally suggest it to every traveler to Madrid...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BridFirtear
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Emperador hotel for four nights at the end of July. The staff were amazing , very helpful and informative. The receptionist was welcoming and helped us, as we had been traveling for over 20 hours. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. We chose the hotel due to its central location and rof top pool, would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The pool is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: The best selling point of this hotel is the pool, it has great views of madrid and a great place to relax with a drink at the end of the day. However the downside is that it opens at 10 and closes at 9, so i could not go for a swim before work and sometimes after when i was working late.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in Madrid, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: allaboutcricket
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and it was excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room (no. 528 I think adjacent to lifts) was brilliant. Very spacious with a small balcony which was nice. No noise from the lifts despite our closeness because our room had a hallway and then a bedroom with a separate door although we never closed ours as we didnt need to. The bathroom was a very good size and well laid out. Nice big comfy bed, massive actually. The best thing about this hotel is the pool on the roof. There is a bar/cafe up there with lots of tables and the food is yummy but the sangria is the BEST in madrid and I'm telling you I tried lots and lots of it. The views of the city are very good and the staff up there very nice with waiter service. Plenty of sun loungers too. The water was freezing though so I wasnt tempted but it was nice to chill out and relax in the middle of a city. Towels are provided when you give your room number. We even went to the cafe when we were staying in a different hotel because it was so nice. Location is excellent, five mins from a metro station and five mins from the shopping centre which leads you to the very centre of Madrid which is then another five mins walk to Plaza Mayor.. If I went to Madrid again I would stay in this hotel without question. and they have amaretto di saronno in the piano bar which is always a plus factor for me.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 15 at the Emperador”
Reviews.Author: Connie L
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location, rates and swimming pool on the roof and we were not disappointed. We are a family of 15. Reception was great and gave us rooms as soon as possible. We got one when our first group arrived around 8am. the rooms were small but comfortable and the staff was pleasant. The location was phenomenal for walking around Madrid. The pool was a blessing for weary kids (6-16). Breakfast was good but we wish there were a restaurant in the hotel to have to go out to dinner. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for seeing Madrid”
Reviews.Author: waybackOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: As a base for seeing the sights of Madrid the Emperador is hard to beat. It is 50 metres from the Santo Domingo Metro Station and has numerous cafes, restaurants and tapas bars within half a mile. Our room was sufficiently spacious and had a bathroom that was utterly practical and functional. The pool is more than a pool, the hotel promotes it as a "Beach Club" and although the prices for food, drinks and cocktails are steeper than on the Gran Via it is a very pleasant place to spend an evening looking out over the sights of Madrid. The Emperador doesn't provide 5 star luxury but it certainly provides everything you need for a great trip to Madrid.It is worth taking a travel kettle, mugs, tea and coffeee etc and squeezing a pint of milk into the minibar. The TV only offers CNN News and Sky News in English but Madrid offers plenty of entertainment. We asked for a quiet room, and although we did not have a view at all, we did not hear a single sound in our 5 nights at the Emperador.

Reviews.Title: “great rooftop pool!”
Reviews.Author: azzzure
Reviews.Content: The reason I chose this hotel was the rooftop pool. I got exactly what I was looking for. It was perfect for July in Madrid. The room was newer looking, clean and nice. It was on the small side but being one person it did not matter. I did utilize the fitness center as well which was good enough. The location was between two Metro stops that made it easy for travelling around the city. There is plenty of shopping to do nearby which is always a plus for me. A good location. I am not sure if I would reserve this hotel for any other time except in the heat of the summer specifically for the pool. The price otherwise is high when compared to other hotels in the area. The biggest downfall to this hotel is the surgcharge for wifi. It adds almost $20 extra per day if you decide to purchase it and it is very weak.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: What can I say, 3 hours into my sleep after a 20 hour day, the workmen doing the construction work on this old building removed my window with hammer and chisel. I video'd the whole event and showed reception who just shrugged their shoulders and ignored me. Ok so construction work was going on but why put guests in a room that is still under construction and then not even offer a refund of the very expensive charge. It may be an average hotel once complete, the rooms are small and the bathrooms smaller but I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123eki
Reviews.Content: Hotel location on Gran Via 53 is absolutely great, location in center Madrid is nice. My room Club- Room was quite large and there was balcony also.. The view was great. Breakfast morning time was excellent. Room was very clean. Very easy to get Taxi from Hotel. Service was just great and security also. executive lounge was nice. When i am visiting in Madrid next time i will visit this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for all ages”
Reviews.Author: AmieOldham
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this hotel as a base for sightseeing in Madrid. The location was just perfect right on Gran Via and with walking distance to most of the top sights and attractions. We chose the romantic offer and had a very large room with a bottle of champagne on arrival, only downfall was the view of a brick wall but being on the 9th floor we saw a bit of light. This was a slight downfall as on one of the nights an event was being held on the roof top pool which was extremly noisy and went on till about 1/2 in the morning. We had booked a tour early the next morning so this was a slight disappointment. The pool is the best asset of this hotel, it is extremly clean and beautifully decorated, up there you can forget the hustle and bustle of the busy streets below. Will definately choose this hotel again if travelling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Schnauzer15
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel with good facilities, very close to all the sights of Madrid and therefore ideal for a city break. The swimming pool on the roof of the hotel is superb, the view from the roof are fantastic. This hotel is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Value”
Reviews.Author: DinoraInVentura
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Gran Via, the major thoroughfare in the center of Madrid. Rooms are small but comfortable and impeccably clean. I find that, if I want to stay in a historical area, most European hotel rooms are smaller than what we expect in the US. One can walk to Prado, Reina Sofia, Thyssen-Bornemissa, Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor, and other attractions from here. The staff here was efficient and friendly. As a matter of fact, the European Cup Finals were taking place while I was here, and the bar staff actually started to ask me if I was planning to return for the next game. They made room for my friends and me each time. Same treatment when the wining team was received with a parade that passed by the hotel on Grand Via. If anyone is interested, I paid anywhere from 15 to 22 euros for breakfasts at 5 different hotels during this trip. The staff at the breakfast was also extremely helpful: asked for and received hot chocolate each day even though it was not offered as part of the regular fare.

Reviews.Title: “Worst honeymoon ever!!!1”
Reviews.Author: Serena J
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in! In April, after a lovely wedding in a lovely hotel, we were looking forward to our honeymoon in Madrid! What a let down! We thought the taxi had brought us to the wrong hotel as the building was so shrouded in scaffolding we could not recognise it as the one advertised! When we got to our room, it was very disappointing. It was very small and very musty. We went down to complain to a very disinterested manager who told us that there were no other rooms for us to move to. His attitude was "take it or leave it"! As there were workmen outside our windows creating dust and noise, we could not leave them open for ventilation, and with the air-conditioner blowing out hot, not cool air, sleeping was made very uncomfortable. When we got home we complained to the tour company as there were no reps on site. The tour company did not want to know! For every complaint we made, they had an excuse. We demanded a refund as we felt our honeymoon was ruined and the hotel was not fit for purpose! They told us that they did not feel there was a problem as the outside of the hotel was only receiving a light cleaning! What do they think we are stupid? You dont need drills and heavy machinery for light cleaning!!! One of the previous reviewers says that they took out one of his windows while he was in the room. Light cleaning indeed!!! Would never recomend this hotel to anyone else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MJMNewYork
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Emperador with my husband and 7 year-old son. We were in a corner Junior Suite, and it was huge! My son loved it because there was so much room for him to play. The rooftop pool is a major perk of this hotel. It is like an oasis after a day of sightseeing in hot, dry Madrid. Two negatives about the pool area for young children: there is no shallow end, it's all deep water. Also, the pool water is very cold! If you are only with adults or older children, it wouldn't be an issue. It really is very pleasant up there. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. My son really liked Alfonso, he was always very friendly to us. I speak Spanish, so I had an easier time communicating than someone who doesn't . The breakfast buffet was good with plenty of options. We had this included with our room. You needed a ticket, though, to go to the omelette station. The first day, the guy at the entrance gave me a ticket without me even asking. The next day, he didn't hand me one. I asked for it, and he said he had to check to see if that was on my plan. I told him that he had given me one the day before, and so he gave me one,no problem. We really liked the atmosphere of this hotel. It is very centrally located. You are within easy walking distance of the Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. The "Santo Domingo" Metro station is right across the street. You couldn't ask for a better location. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very glad we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: HL2115
Reviews.Content: Having previously spent quite a bit of time in Madrid I have a fairly good idea of where/where not to stay, and chose here for when visiting with family. I'm very glad we did - it was an excellent stay. It is definitely not cheap, but you get everything you'd expect in a 4-star hotel. The room was lovely - very spacious, good facilities and we got a Gran Vía view, despite not having selected this more expensive option, which I was very pleased with. The rooftop is definitely the highlight - the pool was a little cold, but the view definitely made up for this and the pool-side service was also excellent. The staff were also very friendly and helpful, and needless to say the location is about as good as you can get - it's right next to Santo Domingo metro station, and about 2 minutes walk from both Plaza de Espana and Callao. Overall a brilliant stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Jaheto
Reviews.Content: Just meters from the San Domingo metro station the hotel is on the main shopping street of Madrid within easy walking distance of the other main pedestrian shopping areas, theatres, cinemas, museums and tourist attractions including the Royal Palace which we could see from the window of our room. The rooms are small but well equipped and comfortable with everything you need though a few extra TV channels would have been appreciated. Did not use the internet or breakfast offered due to the exhorbitant prices. The foyer of the hotel is very much 4 star, likewise the reception staff who proved very informative with information regarding transport and restaurants. Had the best Paella and a great Tapas through their recommendations. Best of all, during the summer months, is the roof top pool with large sun-bathing area, plenty of free sunbeds. Amazing place to cool down and relax after a day shopping and sightseeing in very hot weather. The cocktails, other drinks are well priced and they have a very good selection of food and snacks. I would not hesitate in booking this hotel again if I was to return to Madrid during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Two reasons for staying here”
Reviews.Author: ExpatSouthernSpain
Reviews.Content: The two reasons are: the location (on the Gran Via); and the roof-top pool. The pool alone (as far as I know, the only one of its kind in Central Madrid) would clinch it for me! Unfortunately, there are downsides. The breakfast is a ludicrous 19 euros, the internet is 13 euros a day, and a small black coffee will set you back 4.50 euros. These are 'four-star' prices, and (although the public areas are fairly smart) this is where the 'four stars' end: the standard rooms are on the small side, and unimaginatively furnished - you're also quite likely to get a view of nothing more scenic than a brick wall. However, at the end of a sweltering day in Madrid, all you think about is that pool.

Reviews.Title: “man soup on roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Robert-Chiswick
Reviews.Content: Have Stayed here for Madrid pride many times. positive points: superb roof terrace and pool cleanliness of rooms and common areas location- walking distance to most things and tube Most staff helpful apart from the odd one spanish style decor with even chandeliers in room negative points: Even though we booked a business classic room, no tea or coffee facilities were available even though previously having this. I asked as reception and was told it is not available lacked attention to detail to maintenance issues The Club room has changed location from previous years and although it was handy to watch the pride parade outside ( although they closed the room promptly on time at 11pm even though parade still in full swing- no flexibility) lacked soul or anything luxurious. Looked more like an old people's home lounge tips get tube from airport - easy for breakfast or just for a snack- walk across the road and down the street to a "museum of jamon" ( not a museum) You can get a delicious cheese and ham sandwiches for 1.5 euros and coffee and ham sandwiches for 1 euro each mixed views- may be worth paying for access for the club room especially if you are visiting with friends. I hope management improves the environment however similar to the previous club room with carpets and a bar with beer on tap with the suggestion of added local wine Ask for larger room. Double glazing in all rooms so noise not an issue with traffic Take swimming costumes/trunks goggles-towels provided

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, great locale”
Reviews.Author: FlyerCG
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, if not helpful. The rooms are small, well worn and INCREDIBLY NOISY. I have spent a lifetime in hotel rooms, and I regularly sleep with earplugs, but this place is awful. There is a sizable gap under every doo, and I can assure you, you will hear every conversation (and more) in the hallways and rooms surrounding your own. Plus, there is tons of construction going on in the hotel right now. I was asleep (8 a.m.) and heard someone outside my window (5th floor). A workman was tearing my window out to replace it! I complained to the front desk, and they assured me that the work would be done in the next few hours! "You should be up anyway." Noted. At least it was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: silverwedding
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend break in June. We booked a Club room, but not sure if that is what we got! The first room we were given had doors to the balcony that didn't close properly and we were moved to the 8th floor, which was a much nicer room. The location is excellent - within walking distance of all the major sights. We didn't have breakfast here as they wanted 19 euros per person, but there are lots of places to have a quick breakfast a few minutes walk away. The pool is a great asset - just a shame they can't do something about the pigeons! Would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in the middel of Madrid. Close to shopping, restaurants, sights and best of all, the swimmingpool on the rooftop, after an long day wandering around the city. Drinks are a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at the Emperador Hotel Madrid and would stay again. The service was great at all times and the only slight negative comments would be that the club room facilities were not always topped up,

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: betterthanwork
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a Club room first week of July. Grand reception area, no issues checking in. Club room acceptable, but smaller than expected. Good view over Gran Via from 6th floor. Double glazing keeps out most street noise, other than the numerous emergency vehicle sirens - take ear plugs! Breakfast not included with my booking, so chose to eat out and also did not buy any food or drink due to the high prices (€11 for a cocktail). Did make use of the Emperador Club, which was nice and cool after a day's walking, but as every one else has mentioned, a poor selection and limited supply of drinks available. Only used the rooftop pool for short bursts. Busy on the Sunday, but quieter in the week (approx 100 sun loungers). Limited natural shade available as no umbrellas.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Coach-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: I stayed a weekend here. The price was 4 star, but the room just missed the mark. We thought the room was pretty nice and spacious, except it had water damaged and mildewed wall paper below the AC vents. Housekeeping didn't replenish our toilet paper. The 1970's toilet had to be fixed while we were there. There were a few things included with our price. The pool area was very nice with chairs and a bar, and the gym built for 2 people was adequate...for two people at a time. Everything else had a steep fee (breakfast, WiFi). The staff up front were very nice and helpful. I just wish our room was a little better maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i've ever been”
Reviews.Author: Oudebrunink
Reviews.Content: The Emperador hotel in Madrid is one of the worst when not the worst hotel I’ve ever seen. The rooms are very small fort he price you have to pay and also dirty. The rooms are far overpriced and don’t have the quality you expect and they promise you. The rooms are small and you have hardly space to put your suitcase. I stayed in this hotel 5 nights and non of these days the room has been cleaned. The staff doesn’t know how to serve people and how to deal with complains. The first thing they say it is he fault of the customer it self. The Emperador hotel uses a card system as a key to open your room. In the 5 days I stayed there three times I as no able to open the door and had to go down to get a new card. Even when I came home late I was not able to get in the room and had to wait long before I was able to open the door and go to bed. Of course they claimed it was my fault. I would have kept my card to near my cell phone. I can tell you this wasn’t the case. Also three friends of mine, who stayed in this hotel, had two times he same problem. The management of this hotel is incompetent too. I tried to have a normal conversation with the manager but this as impossible. The first thing she does is to blame the customer he/she made a mistake. Never did the hotel. I WOULD ADVICE EVERY ONE NOT TO BOOK A ROOM IN THIS HOTEL. YOU CAN EASILY FIND A FAR BETTER HOTEL FOR A LOWER PRICE IN THIS WONDERFUL CITY.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Toffeeman1878
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Managed to get a cheap deal through a website which made a big difference - the walk-up rates are very expensive. Everything other reviews say about the roof-top pool is correct - it's beautiful and clean with plenty of sun loungers and a bar with excellent food and service. The room was ok. It was a little on the small side but was clean and had mini-bar, tv, air-con, safe, nice large wardrobe and plenty of storage. The bathroom was a decent size with a good power shower. The location makes this hotel perfect though. It's right next to Santo Domingo metro and 2 minutes from Plaza d'Espana metro. It's perfect fr walking around central Madrid and seeing all the attractions of this beautiful city. Overall, providing you can secure a decent rate it's a great hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Roof Top Pool and Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: felicity M
Reviews.Content: My partner and i were staying for a long weekend with another couple in the middle of summer. We spent most of our time beside the pool over looking Madrid. Sipping cocktails. Fantastic Location. Minets away from a gorgeous city park, trendy bars, City center shopping. You could really ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “god send roof pool in the city”
Reviews.Author: becky292210
Reviews.Content: we have just stayed at the emperador hotel for a weekend city break , party of 3 couples, this hotel is right in the centre and you can walk from here to most of the great sites in the city, or just get the metro which is just outside the hotel, the rooms where of average size, clean and decor was ok, the building is a old one, but looks great, our room had a showe and a seperate bath which was a bones, but the main selling point to me is the roof pool, this was great to relax before and after sight seeing , it was great on the last day as we had a late flight, we just put our bags behind reception and doshed at the pool for the afternoon, if your traveling from the airport by metro get of two blocks down the grand via at stop plaza de espana and walk up this way you just get two metro lines , line 8 then line 10 from the airport, as no point getting the third line line 2, for one stop to demingo as , its only two blocks up the grand via from espana, if i go to madrid again i would use this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the rooftop pool makes it!!”
Reviews.Author: Ker085
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 nights in the Emperador and had a brilliant time! Would definitely recommend this hotel! It is very easy to get to Plaza de espana (1 metro change and only a few minutes walk from hotel) for 4.5euros per person, taking around 30minutes. The staff were very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. After asking to change rooms, due to a dull wall view room, we were told we could do the following day which we were happy with and glad we did as we got a city view room on the 7th floor which was lovely and more modern. The room was clean, bed was comfy and it was very quiet. We were slightly disappointed with breakfast, not realising that it was continental and would cost more for the hot buffet and the staff were not very attentive, but the coffee was good and we made up for eating in lovely places throughout our stay. The rooftop pool is lovely and it made our stay as it turned a city break into a relaxing summer holiday at the same time. There are plenty of sun loungers and towels. The pool is cold but very refreshing on a hot day and the views are amazing!! The hotel is located on the busy Gran Via with plenty of places to eat and drink and feels safe even at night. Head to El Corte Ingles (supermarket) for bottled water, only 32cent for 2litres. Turn left out of hotel and cross the street to find La Surena, sit outside and enjoy a bucket of beer and tapas for only 9euros. Go on a thu for Doble mania(2 tapas for 1). They have another in Cava Baja and just outside Plaza Mayor. TGI Fridays (close to La Surena) have happy hour Mon-Fri 5-8pm so a good starting point close to the hotel for a night out. We ate at many different places and think the best way is not to plan in advance and just see what you think looks good. We loved Cava Baja (a MUST at night,15min walk from hotel in Latin quarter). A street full of tiny little tapas bars where you can have a drink and a tapas then move on. We did the Madrid City Bus Tour which cost 20euros per person and we bought our tickets from the hotel reception. You can catch the bus across the road from the hotel, outside KFC, and can get on and off as you please. There are 2 routes and the ticket lets you do both. We chose to use this to get to Bernabeu Stadium which was a must see and enjoyable tour. Madrid is beautiful and there is lots to see including the Ratiro Park where you can hire a rowing boat for under 5euros for 45minutes which was lovely. We were a little concerned about pick pocketing but had no problems. My boyfriend carried is wallet in his front shorts pocket and I had a shoulder bag which I kept my hand on at all times, maybe sounds a little over the top but it was safe. Best to be aware of your surroundings at all times and during busy areas or sitting down outside keep hold of your belongings and you should be fine. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend Madrid and the Emperador!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Lezmark13
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we'd stayed at the Emperador. It's well-situated and we like the fact that it has a rooftop pool. The hotel isn't the most funkily-furnished property in the world, but it's got a certain taste of grandeur and history that we liked on our previous visit. Check in was quick, and even though we arrived late morning and weren't expecting to be able to access the room till later, it was ready for us. We'd booked a Club Room as the holiday was to celebrate an anniversary, and the room itself was large with a view of the Gran Via. What was disappointing was the Club Lounge - to quote the website, "the exclusive private VIP room Club Emperador, offering an inviting ambiance, a magnificent view of the Gran Via, high-tech facilities and a variety of beverages." It was tired, small and the variety of beverages extremely poor - soft drinks, beer, vodka, two different types of peach liqueur, and another couple of random spirits. There were wine glasses and no wine...We stayed an hour and a half, with a group of around 5 English businessmen at close quarters talking loudly about their work (not their fault, but the room was so small that it wasn't really condusive to an "inviting ambiance"). No staff appeared during the time we were there, to replenish anything or tidy up. To cap it all, they were setting up a function room next door, so we were treated to furniture getting hauled about and loud bursts of music as they did the sound checks. Don't waste your money by upgrading to the Club Rooms at this hotel if your reason is to enjoy the Club Lounge - you'd be better off heading for a Madrid bar with the moneyyou save, as you'd have more drinks choices and a far better atmosphere. The Emperador could learn an awful lot from Marriott and Hilton as to how an executive lounge should be run. Check out was a long process as there are only 3 checkout desks, so took around 15 minutes. All in all, not the best hotel experience we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, rooftop pool overlooking the city”
Reviews.Author: Anne W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights when visiting Madrid to see Bruce Springsteen. Hotel easy to reach from the airport on the metro. Room & bathroom was v spacious, with a great shower. Room v quiet despite overlooking the main street. Central location with easy access to more than 1 metro station. Highlight was the rooftop pool with great views over Madrid, tasty food and refreshing cocktails to be enjoyed by the pool. Staff v friendly. would definitely stay at this hotel next time I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loacation”
Reviews.Author: Sinead B
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here. 3 of us shared the room and found it very spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful. There's a choice of 3 or 4 different Metro lines within walking distance from Hotel. Less than 20mins Metro ride has you at the airport. Did not have breakfast in the hotel but found a restaurant (VIPS) within walking distance which offered a good choice including vegatarian and cost less than €7 each incl tip. Rooftop pool was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlenParvaRich
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here. Ideal central location on the Gran Via, easy to get to on the Metro from the airport. Room was clean,staff were friendly. Rooftop pool was excellent - great to spend an hour or 2 there after a days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anonymousbrighton
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in a standard double room. The room was a bit basic & while the decor was tired, the room was, as requested , in a very quiet part of the hotel. The bed was a bit hard ( we did ask if we could change rooms or upgrade but the hotel was full). The staff were really helpful, giving directions, recommending restaurants & making telephone bookings for us. We took our own travel kettle as there weren't tea of coffee making facilities in the room. The rooftop terrace and pool was a godsend ( even if the pool was freezing!) in the hot weather and while busy, we always managed to find beds and some shade. Access to the metro is excellent. Taxis to and from the airport only took 15 mins approx ( around 25 - 30 euros). We didn't eat in the hotel: lots of restaurants and cafes close by. If you're used to boutique hotels then this is quite basic but the location makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but choose your room”
Reviews.Author: thingx
Reviews.Content: You need to ask for a room with a street view here. Our room looked directly onto a service courtyard and we didn't see daylight all the time we were there. Our friends had rooms overlooking the street and they were larger and lighter. There are also rooms with small balconies, which are even better and were the same price. The rooms were clean. The beds comfortable and we found the staff very friendly and helpful, apart from the waiting staff in the breakfast room who seemed to be totally indifferent unless the supervisor gave them a bit of a kick. The pool was a great bonus here but unfortunately, if there is a wedding or other function, it closes early and hotel guests are booted out. Check before you book! I would book here again but would be a bit specific about my room requirements.

Reviews.Title: “In the action”
Reviews.Author: aussiesinspain
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 night stay in a Junior Suite overlooking the Gran Via. We booked the suite because we were 3 adults and a child, and it was large and beautifully appointed. like others, we arrived from the airport by metro and couldn't believe it when we popped up almost at the front door! The metro is not seamless, by the way. Two line changes are required so it is not easy with luggage -- but quite do- able. There was some street noise but this can be negated at night by closing the windows. The street noise and scenes actually add to the excitement of being in Madrid. We found the staff pleasant and the breakfast very good. The rooftop pool is large and deep and there are plenty of sun chairs. It is as freezing as the ocean! I have no idea why but it makes for fairly short dips! I imagine it would be fantastic in July and august. I think there are probably good and bad rooms in this hotel. The website is clear about room features and prices so you can book with your eyes wide open.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: Janey1UnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: We visited for 4 nights in June and found the hotel to be very good. Not sure why others have made such negative comments as we we had no major to complain about. As others have stated it's about 50 mins on the metro (4.50 euros inclusive of airport supplement) to either Plaza De Espana (uphill walk) or Callao (downhill walk) both about 5 mins. Directly outside the hotel is Santo Domingo station but you will have more underground changes to get to this station. The hotel is in an old building and the interior decor befits this and is located centrally to get you anywhwere within Madrid, either on foot or by public transport. They are putting in new double glazing on one side of the hotel so scaffolding is evident. The reception is bright and clean and the reception staff were lovely. Our room was on the 3rd floor and faced the main street but due to the double glazing we could not hear any traffic noise. There was a flat screen tv, kettle and bathrobes in the room. The bed was a little on the small side. The bathroom had a hairdryer, bath over shower and toilletries that were replenished daily - even conditioner! Clean and modern. Of course the roof top pool is an added bonus, with lovely views and plenty of loungers. There is a bar there also. The pool is open until 9pm. We did not eat in the hotel, but the price of drinks were those of any city hotel. There are plenty of places to have breakfast nearby at cheaper prices than the hotel. It is easy to walk around Madrid but the metro is great too. It costs 1.5 euros per single journey, these can mount up so the tourist travel card for 13 euros for 2 days is good value. I wish we had bought it. A great restaurant we found was Casa Mona near the cable car. Just walk right from entrance and it's up a few streets along. It was trendy, quirky, full of locals and the cheapest and best food we had. I have no problem in recommending this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccommended”
Reviews.Author: Ritaod
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed here in June and found the hotel to be very good. It's easy to get to from the airport, 4.50 euros fare on the metro, took about 50 mins, (metro Plaza de Espana). Very well located, walking distance to everything. Rooftop terrace a definite bonus to relax after a busy day sightseeing. Room was great- a good size and nice bathroom . There was work being done on the outside so you couldn't open the window because of scaffolding. Expensive to eat there though, 2 ice creams cost 9 euros!! We also hired bikes from Bravo bikes.We took a city tour with them for 3 hours for 25 euros. It was excellent, very entertaining and informative. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “central location perfect for short break”
Reviews.Author: icklebeck
Reviews.Content: this hotel offers a perfect location for a short stay in the city. Main metro lines within few minute walk. don't bother with breakfast as plenty options around the hotel for far less than in hotel. pool and terrace is amazing offering fab views and place to chill. would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What are people complaining about?!!!”
Reviews.Author: andrewlodge77
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand the negative comments this hotel has had. It is a beautiful old building on a fantastic street in an amazing location, and the inside fits perfectly with this. Our room was a good size with a decent clean bathroom- cleaned and refilled with toiletries every day. The staff were always helpful with us when we asked advice. Can't comment on the food as we didn't eat there- why would you when madrids restaurants are all around you. Rooftop pool was a great way to end a day of sightseeing- drinks expensive but to be expected. Great trip, great city, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Under refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: up2eleven
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 5 nights but had to check out after the first night. There was a whole series of problems but the biggest ones were as follows: They have scaffolding up outside the building and the construction work starts at 8AM (very noisy). Parking costs €30 per night and there is very little alternative. Wifi is slow and expensive. Rooms are very dated. What they call a triple room is more like a double with a camp bed crammed into a corner. They cannot do interconnecting rooms for families with 4 kids (they told us on the phone we could but then when we arrived they said they had no such rooms). The lifts take ages (I don't just mean a couple of minutes) to arrive. There is a window in the bathroom which a toddler can easily open by standing on the toilet. The window opens onto a sheer 10 floor drop in some sort of internal space. We had to block the bathroom door just in case. In fairness to the staff, though, they were not surprised we wanted to check out and whilst they were indifferent they were not rude.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: amazingmuppet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find and in a perfect location. The hotel looks as if it has been recently refurbished but on closer inspection, it is clear that corners have been cut. The hotel pool is definitely the selling point with this hotel, there are plenty of sun loungers but unfortunately there are plenty of hotel guests so finding a spare lounger is difficult but not impossible. The staff in reception are the rudest people I have had the misfortune to come across. They can't understand the simplest requests when checking in and prefer to argue with customers when we discovered charges on our bills that weren't ours. The manager was just as bad as the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located posh hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkkk64
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but were very lucky with the weather and managed to make use of the roof top pool. They provide a towel for the pool and there were plenty of sunloungers. The pool was a welcome relaxation after a days walk around Madrid. Breakfast was expensive so we skipped it and being central there was loads of choice to eat out!!! The room and ensuite was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: joannegromito
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a long weekend in Madrid. Read all the reviews before we went and decided to stay here as the location was good. We were expecting an awful room, rude staff, hard beds but didn't experience any of the them. We couldn't understand why everyone was complaining. We had a good sized twin room, lovely bathroom, okay the view was of the back of the hotel but we didn't spend any time looking out of the window! The breakfasts were fine and the staff efficient and helpful. The reception staff were very helpful and polite. We enjoyed the roof top swimming pool, sunbathing area, which was great to relax in after a hot day in the city. It's a shame the hotel is having poor reviews,our advice would be, try it and see.

Reviews.Title: “Emperor of the Grand Via”
Reviews.Author: MarkPLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night family break in Madrid at Emperador over the Jubilee weekend. We had two connecting rooms with a discount rate with Hotel Direct. Breakfast not included but overall good value. Rooms were OK. Good beds, hot water and TVs but a bit dated and no view. Lifts were slow. We had breakfast one morning; food and selection good but very expensive (EUR 20 each). Better to use nearby cafes for coffee & pastries or chocolate & churros. The location is excellent - 5 mins walk to Sol, 10 mins to Plaza Mayor and tapas in Plaza Santa Ana. We walked to Prado, Royal Palace etc and easy access to airport via Plaza de Espana metro. There is an outstanding rooftop pool and terrace which makes this an excellent place to stay when it is open from June to October. Probably needs a refurbishment but we would return given pool and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Sue H
Reviews.Content: Found location convenient to whichever direction you were headed, close to Metra stops and tour bus stops. Room was fine. Roof top pool and bar great place to relax in the afternoon. Staff not overly helpful, but not outright rude, either.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, but the room was pretty bad and the lobby reeks of smoke all the time. The room was tiny, the bed hard as a rock, it smelled like sewer in our room. There was a"mini bar" in the room which consisted of a tiny refrigerator which didn't work. Wifi was available but cost $5.00 for 30 minutes!!!! The only decent thing about the room was the bathroom. The pool area on the rooftop is nice but isn't enough to makeup for te rest of the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest and most unmannerly staff I have ever encountered in all my travels.”
Reviews.Author: Ann B
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Emperador Hotel the first week in May. It was our first mother and daughter trip away and we were looking forward to it with great anticipation. The hotel was recomended by two sets of friends who we knew are very fussy where they stay and even though it was a few years ago when they stayed there, they were both very happy with the product. On their advice I also upgraded to the Emperador Club status which gives you an upgraded room plus complimentary drinks plus snacks & newspapers while you are staying there. The hotel itself is in a very convenient location - reception was decorated very nice and everything was very shiney and clean. However that is where I have to finish with the compliments as it the first time I have had to write a bad review like this - but I'm afraid someone at this hotel needs to hear. In all my travels around the world and in all the hotel's from 1 to 5 star grades that I have stayed in I have never ever come across a ruder and less helpfull set of staff in all my life. From the time we booked in to the time we left, it was like as if it was a burden or beneath them to answer simple mannerly questions not only to us but to several other guests we met while having our 4 days stay at the hotel The morning we arrived I asked for a recomendation for a nice restaurant for lunch as I wanted to treat my daughter to somewhere special on our first day in Madrid. The gentleman ( I use that term loosley) who was checking us in waved one hand in the air, and said " Out the door, turn right and there's lots of nice restaurants up there on the plaza. When I asked him very quitely and mannerly could he recomend one that did good food with good service - his reply was " They're all good " . At this point let me reliably inform that same gentleman that they are NOT all good. However in a lovely art gallery just down from the Grand Via a very nice lady was more than helpfull, directed us to exactly what we were looking for. I would also like to point out that we were'nt even asked would we like help with our bags upstairs when we were booking in, which for a 4 come 5 star hotel is most unusual. That evening when we came back we went down for what we thought were our complimentary drinks before bed, only to be asked to pay. I informed the waiter that we had upgraded to the Emperador club and thought our drinks were complimentary - to which he replied - " NO, your in the wrong place". I asked where we were supposed to be and he said " Ask at the reception". So back up again I went to another Mr. Happy at reception who told me that I should have been told all this when I checked in. I told him that it was our first time both in Madrid and at the hotel and that we were told nothing but our room number when we had checked in that morning. He then tried to pass it off with another sweep of his hand saying that all the information was in the room. I told him the only information in our room was a book on the phone desk about the sights to see around Madrid. He then very abruptly then said " Well it does'nt matter the Emperador Club is now closed for the night. So I paid for our drinks and went to bed. We eventually did find the Emperador Club the next evening after we came back from sightseeing - but - if your expecting the full selection of drinks they advertise on their website then you will again be very disapointed. If you dont drink Gin, Scotch, Beer or some very sweet Peach Liquer then you are out of luck, because those plus some soft drinks and water is all they have available. I did ask a lady who was there servicing the Club was this the full selection and she said yes. So if you, like my daughter and I, happen to drink wine then take my advice and dont bother upgrading to Club because it's a waste of money. However the last straw came the morning we were checking out and I was paying the bill. I, as I always do asked for a print out to keep for my records. I would like to say that the receptionist handed it to me - but unfortunately she did'nt. Instead she plonked it down very roughly in front of me with a pen alongside it. I presumed she wanted me to sign it and asked her where she wanted me to do so. Abruptly she said she did'nt need a signature, just my credit card which I had in my hand. I was just leaning forward to hand it to her when she abruptly snapped it out of my hand - and I do mean snapped. To say that I was left speechless is an understatement and my daughter who was standing behind me came forward and asked " Did I just see what I saw her do". I said yes and my daughter immediately asked for a comment card. At this stage the receptionist got very flustered and said at first that they were in the rooms. When my daughter told her that there was no information what so ever in our room she miraculousley found one which we filled up and posted at the desk. I really dont know if it was any use filling that card in because I doubt if it was ever even read as neither I or my daughter has heard anything back from the hotel as of yet. Please dont get me wrong Madrid is a beautiful city with very fine architecture, art galleries, bus tours and shopping and we did have a lovely time there - it's only a pity we stayed at the Emperador Hotel. I dont really dont know why they were so rude, whether it was the construction that was going on outside or whethere it was just that they were having a few bad days. What ever it was actually does'nt matter really because neither I or my daughter or any of my family or the friends that recomended it will EVER be staying at the Emperador Hotel again. I would also NOT under any circumstances what so ever recomend it to anyone else to stay there. Apologies again for the poor review but like I said before, this is the first time in my life that I felt I had to write such a bad review about such poor service. Unfortunately, with the exception of the housekeeping ladies ( who were lovely) I have never had such bad service in a hotel in all my travels in all my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: We had a large triple room which was very nice, with traditional decor. The pool area is great but the pool is freezing and drinks expensive. The food at the pool area is nice and reasonably priced, we did not eat in the restaurant, why would you when you have the whole of Madrid on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars??”
Reviews.Author: munir123
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in 2009 while on a business trip, I have to say the location of the hotel is amazing, the hotel is nice, clean, especially the bathrooms, which are very very clean. But I don't consider it as a 4 star hotel due to 1 reason, the rooms are soooooo tiny, I was shocked when I entered the room, I've never seen such a tiny hotel room in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Use as a base to explore the city.”
Reviews.Author: Raymond S
Reviews.Content: A bit showy (plush lobby, gun-toting guard) but underneath the glitz a standard hotel that is useful as a base to explore the city. Rooms are reasonably appointed - mine was a bit cramped for a double - and comfortable. Other than a noisy guest next door at 2.30am, I have no complaints. We got a good weekend rate that included a complementary bottle of (cheap but not nasty) bubbly on the first night – we had several parties in the three rooms we used. Breakfast looked expensive, so we used the very nice Pain Quotidien just up the road. The rooftop pool - the hotel's only USP - opened the weekend we were there. It was still too cold to use though. It looks lovely - very deep - but is, I would imagine, only usable in high summer when the roof will be mobbed with guests. Fine as a place to lay your head after a hard day's sight-seeing and evening's eating and drinking, but not really an event in itself.

Reviews.Title: “A fine, centrally-located, weekend break hotel with a couple of positives and negatives”
Reviews.Author: FoodWineHols
Reviews.Content: I'd actually rate this hotel 'good' but it errs more towards very good than average. Our room was very spacious, with a large entry corridor, big bay window and high ceilings which had a lovely old chandelier that added some vintage glamour. It was certainly bigger than your average hotel room. It had begun to look a bit tired - old curtains and carpet etc, but not desperately in need of a refurb..yet. The two let-downs were, firstly, the bathroom had a bad smell of drains. We considered moving but we were only there for two nights and figured we could stick it out. Secondly, we had a nice view of the street below, but that meant it was quite noisy - general traffic and horns beeping etc. Again, not a dealbreaker and we stuck it out. Upsides are the location - if you don't fancy the short walk to most sights, the metro stop is right outside. Anywhere that still has coffee/tea facilities in the room also gets a bonus point in my book - too many places these days don't! We went on the romantic deal, which includes a bottle of cava, which was very nice and pretty good quality. I would probably stay again, but might look at other deals elsewhere first. We originally booked here as it's one of the few hotels in Madrid with an outdoor pool, but in the event it rained anyway! In short, you can't go too far wrong if you're looking for a city-centre base when exploring is more of a focus than where you're staying! I'd say it's got one or two more years before it needs an extensive refurb.

Reviews.Title: “My first visit will be my last”
Reviews.Author: xon
Reviews.Content: The room on the eight floor was noisy- it was possible to hear clearly what was going on next door. Worse, the staff were inattentive and, on one occasion, downright rude. Breakfast was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: AirlineFreak
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our Easter break in Madrid, since it was the best value among central hotels, but we only realised quite how central the location was once we got there. Right on the Gran Via, which I would say is on the nothern edge of the core of the city centre, within walking distance of everywhere. In our booking, we had requested a double bed, but we were shown to a room with two single beds. When enquiring about whether we could change rooms, it was possible, but we were told that we had been upgraded to a junior suite and another room would be a standard room facing the interior (the suite was facing the Gran Via). We therefore decided to stay, thinking we could push the beds together, but it later turned out that the beds were screwed into the wall (!) and immovable. At that point, we had used the room and it felt too late to change our minds and move anyway, so we ended up sharing a single bed the first night and sleeping in separate beds the second. Not ideal. The room was large, although it was of course a suite, and the bathroom was very nice. Good shower. The room decor was a bit dated and tired, though. If I had booked and paid for a suite in a 4-star hotel in a prime location, I probably would have expected more. Even at the rate we paid, one might have expected a more modern finish, but I appreciate that we booked during the expensive Easter period and that rates might be lower at other times. Staff were very nice, courteous and helpful at all times. My girlfriend speaks Spanish (and I kept quiet), so I don't know how it would have been if speaking English. The place has great potential. I would say it is currently a hotel with a four-star location, four-star service, but three-star rooms. However, I wouldn't be surprised if the hotel will be refurbished soon.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice and superb location”
Reviews.Author: GBR007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights as a base whilst on business - arriving Thursday night at 10pm - quick front of house service and installed into my room and then downstairs for a late evening drink all within 5 minutes. My room 703 was fine - a bit small - internal views! But the bathroom was fine, the room spotlessly clean. We booked through Trail Finders and our rate included breakfast. This was fine, a good range of hot and cold foods, ideal for loading up on fruits ahead of a busy day, the coffee was good too, service friendly, brisk and unobtrusive. Emperador has a superb location - perfect for theatres, museums, shopping - Madrid is a immensely walkable city and this hotel has an enviable position. Just 300 meters from metro stations - Euro 2.50 to the airport - leaving the hotel, you will be in the main terminal building within 35-40 minutes, incredibly easy. I have stayed here and also at the Radisson Blu (just a short walk from the Prada) - Emperador beats the Radisson for location, the latter is a better choice for chic rooms - make sure you get a breakfast deal for both! Final point - excellent concierge service both on arrival and also in holding baggage on the Saturday whilst we visited Real Madrid stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel, great location, but noise and service expensive a lot.”
Reviews.Author: Jundiai
Reviews.Content: The hotel features a luxurious lobby, however, is impossible to sleep between 0 and 7 hrs, because any noise is heard in the room, very small and acoustic walls unprotected. The hotel is extremely clean, large bathroom. The positive point is the location, but everything is paid and very expensive, Internet costs 7 euros an hour, parking 30 euros a day. I could not sleep well before the noise in the room. I suggest that before analyzing the Mercure, Atlantico and Senator, who have even better location, The employees are friendly, but do not recommend the high price of the hotel with no benefit. There is also a rate of + / - 20% charged on the total stay at time of check out.

Reviews.Title: “Refused to take a phone booking”
Reviews.Author: CustomerConsultant
Reviews.Content: I tried to book this hotel by phone. The first time I phoned they said reservations were closed as it was a holiday. A day later I phoned the number on the website, followed the menu for reservations, spoke to reservations and was told that I could only book online! It appears I need a credit card to book and they cannot take numbers on the phone .. only over the web. I've never come across a hotel that refuses to take a booking by phone and wonder what else they don't do in this hotel .. supply sheets on the beds maybe .. who knows. So I phoned another Madrid hotel and was able to book over the phone!

Reviews.Title: “Not far off perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Hazman91
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing, dead centre of Madrid, you couldn't get any closer to everything if you tried! Stayed in July 2011 and the rooftop swimming pool area was perfect for a mid-city quick getaway from the hustle and bustle of the busy city. The room we stayed in was a bit on the small side, and also faced the inside walls where the air conditioning extractors were located so instead of fresh air, all we could smell was other people showering. We also hardly got any natural light but we only spent nights in the room so it didn't bother us at all. I didn't see a difference between the 4* of this hotel and other 3*s i have visited in Spain. The breakfast was very good, with a very wide selection of choices and very filling until the afternoon. Overall the hotel was good, location was better than convenient and the staff were helpful when questioned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with helpfull receptionist”
Reviews.Author: NorbertYork
Reviews.Content: Having arrived late from London, check in was very fast with a warm welome. Altough room are of an average size, bathroom is very comfortable. Lifts, corridors and bedroom very clean. Breakfast service efficient food offer good. Breakfast coffee was disapointing as it was brewed too far in advance and tasted stewed.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrian K
Reviews.Content: Position is excellent - 5 min walk from all the action. Rooms however are very dated and in need of an upgrade. Our air conditioning didn't work which made it even more uncomfortable. Definately not what I would expect of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: maureen029
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. On the plus side the location is great and the staff were very helpful regarding directions etc. The hotel was very clean and tidy and our room was nice. Unfortunately the swimming pool was closed until May but this also meant the roof terrace wasnt accessible which was a disappointment given the views from the top were one of the reasons I booked this hotel. Beware of the scaffolding on the side of the hotel overlooking San Bernado. We didnt have any view! Also the taps needed running for several minutes as the water was brown. Loved Madrid and would probably return to this hotel but only in the summer months when the pool is open!

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: davidcarol
Reviews.Content: good hotel,size of room large and comfortable on 6th floor.Location good,nearest metro station 3 mins. walk away is Calleo! The bar-lounge is excellent if a little pricey but after walking Madrid all day was a beautiful relaxing place to unwind! Would use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: christinejersey
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights in Madrid staying at this hotel. Pleased with our choice, fab location on Grand Via , one of the main streets in the city and within walking distance of all sites. Elegant, clean and with attentive staff. Room on small side and at back of hotel so no view but nice and quiet. Rooms at front apparantly are noisy from the street below. Breakfast was good, buffet, fresh and appealing and more than ample. Shame the roof terrace was closed, sign on reception states open May - Aug. Would have been lovely to sit up there at the end of the day with a drink and watch the sun go down - we had fab weather whilst we were there. There is this Emperador Club which no one tried to up grade or sell us. They have they own lounge area and an upgraded breakfast selection. No one seemed to take notice of the sign by the hot food at breakfast saying for Club guests only and people just helped them selves, even to the Champagne on offer! Great Taps bar , out of the hotel turn left and across the road. La Mario (or similar), 2 drinks, tapas and ice cream for 9.50 euros each. Would recommend the walking and Tapas tour we found on Trip Advisor, with Get your Guide. 3 hours, with food and drink for under 12.00 Euros and was a fun way to spend an evening and trying venues and food we would never had ventured into. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation, we got a good deal via Travel Zoo and the comp bottle of Cava went down well after a long day walking our socks off!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Chris L L
Reviews.Content: Room was ok, but no kettle we needed to buy one. They said WiFi was 13 euro per day but we connected onto it without restrictions. Alternatively there is a Starbucks over the road. Breakfast, good service. We asked for some scrambled egg but that was 3.50 euro extra. Cleaner was keen to get us out the room at 11am. She had to come back but she left her what we suspect is her access all rooms key in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Small room, Poor breakfast selection, Spotty Internet”
Reviews.Author: bellboycary
Reviews.Content: PROs: Great location, walkable to most tourist spots CONs: Small room, spotty internet, poor breakfast selection The Emperador (Madrid) is in a great location. Very close to shops and a short walk to Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor (although this is a very walkable city regardless of hotel location). Good value for the price; however, there are trade-offs (see food comment). Lobby Small-ish lobby; the staff were generally friendly and helpful. Very small gift shop and a bar. Conference rooms on the 2 second and 'basement' floors (although the conference rooms on the bottom are windowless). The conference room was fairly poor as they had large posts in the middle room. Room Room was small but average per European standards. Bathroom was average size. Internet was spotty (24-hour purchase) and somewhat unreliable. I had a room facing the Royal Palace (away from street) so the street-noise was minimal. The Royal Palace lights can be bright but they turn off at around midnight. Furniture is modern. Food The breakfast buffet was very disappointing. They had a limited selection of cold/hot food and baked goods. There was an omlet stand; however, it appeared that you needed a special ticket for this (which was not obvious). In addition, the omlet chef was not always present to cook the omlet. Breakfast is definitely not this hotel's strong suit. Nevertheless, there are plenty of shops near the hotel. Surroundings Plenty of food and shopping are nearby. Very close to Sol, Mayor, and Plaza. A bit of a wak if you are going to Prado or the Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, on balance..but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jetflex
Reviews.Content: Room was quite adequate, enough space etc..not luxury but just fine for me. The gym ? ... rubbish. Highlights: Staff..very very good! Location: Excelllent: Roof top pool, again not luxury but a very nice feature with cool views and comfortable loungers. This is not a luxury hotel, but staff and pool make it above average. I will stay here again if less than 80 euro a night! BoyI am getting mean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for madrid tours.”
Reviews.Author: Linworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in Madrid. Wanted a location that we could walk or take public transportation from. This fits the bill. Found it difficult in Madrid to find that many people that wanted to talk to English speakers. Hotel inclueded. Breakfast was ample, room was of standard size with all the ammenities. All and all it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay! The roofpool is top of the pops!”
Reviews.Author: duhku4e
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to check in the Emperador last August, for four nights. Although it does not respond to the criteria for a Palace, this hotel certainly delivers high-level amenities and services. On the pros, I would rank the rooftop pool & garden & bar as THE plus to have. It was defining in my choice for booking at the Emperador at the first place. Imagine how comfortable it is to refresh yourself in the pool during the hot Spanish summer afternoons, and to enjoy a glass of sangria (a pure delight) in your chaise longue, while contemplating the outstanding landscape of Madrid from the 10-th floor terrace. The location and architecture of the building are also great: located downtown, (Gran Via avenue), it is at walking distance from every tourist attraction in the city. The subway station is located just in front of the hotel. The building itself is a mix of Imperial and art-deco styling, that brings an unquestionable charm to the spot. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, although with outdated furniture (especially for the bathroom). Ask for a terrace, you will definitely enjoy it. Staff is very helpful, polite and service-oriented. I got a late check-out upon simple request at the front desk. Finally, I could not enumerate many cons, except perhaps the outdated bathroom and the excessive price of Internet and drinks (Roof- and Lobby bar). Globally, it was a very pleasant stay. Fours stars +.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Worsley
Reviews.Content: Hotel Emperador is easily accessable by the metro from the airport and only having to change once - well worth checking to arrive by the metro as the hotel is then a 2 min walk from the metro! €2 compared to €36 in a taxi!
