The hotel is well maintained, the staff were very helpful and happy to recommend places and restaurants, the staff spoke very good english. The Room I stayed in was huge is was a club room and to be honest I couldnt fault it, with the club room came the use of the club bar which is located on the 1st floor, smallish room but offered self service drinks and bar snacks. The Pool on the roof terrace is lovely with ample sunbeds and a great roof top view of Madrid. The hotel itself is greatly located on the Grand Via close to all the shops, plaza Mayor, the Palace is only a 10min walk from the hotel. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: boadiceactrice
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a luxury hotel, it just offers some luxuries which you wouldn't expect. The rooms are a bit basic, but big enough, especially the bathroom it was lovely and big. The two amazing selling points about this hotel are the location (on the gran via, close to everything), and secondly the upstairs area with pool and sun lounges. The pool water is freezing, so being a wimp about the cold I didn't go in, but the terrace up there is so nice to sit on out there in the sun and have a glass or two of champers, so relaxing. I would come back to Emperador for sure! without a second thought

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Ruela
Reviews.Content: Hotel Emperador is in Gran Via, walking distance to Plaza Mayor and other good places to eat and have drinks. Good bar services and very good restaurant. Their meeting facilities are very helpful for conferences and business. I have just one observation: they dont have standard rooms, i.e. if your got a bad room, ask them for a better one! Bad point: you have to pay extra for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: loveholidays52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Emperador for our wedding anniversary and very much enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and the reception staff very attentive. We were given a free upgrade and a bottle of bubbly to celebrate our special day. Our room had a small balcony so we could watch the world go by and the room was air conditioned so we could shut the windows at night to escape the noise but still be comfortable. The location is very central - right next to a metro station and within an easy walk of the shops on Gran Via, and the old town and main tourist sights. Madrid is a wonderful city to visit, easy to get round, exciting and vibrant with an amazing array of restaurants and bars to choose from. I would highly recommend the Mercado de San Miguel for tapas and a glass of rioja. The Emperador has a gorgeous (if a bit cold!) roof top pool - great for sunbathing and cooling off after a morning's sightseeing. The only gripe I have is that the waiting staff at breakfast were a bit slow to serve us and the bar prices are somewhat inflated - soft drinks actually cost more than a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend break”
Reviews.Author: WestSussexCaroline
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable weekend break staying at the Emperador Hotel. It is very central and in walking distance of most attractions, restaurants and shops. The hotel staff are very friendly and polite. The roof top swimming pool really made it for me. After a morning walking round the Prado there was nothing nicer than a cool swim and sun bathe in the afternoon. The breakfast is good but there is no proper restaurant apart from the pool bar that had a small menu. This was good for us because we prefer to eat outside the hotel in one of the many excellent restaurants in the area. Beware that the tiny bottles of water in the mini fridge in the rooms is very expensive. It is best to buy your own bottled water from outside.

Reviews.Title: “City break in early September 11...”
Reviews.Author: julie g
Reviews.Content: Madrid is fantasitc city and the old part of madrid is very beautiful, lots to see and lovely sights to take in. We stayed at the Emperador on the Gran Via expecting the traffic noise to an issue but it was fine. After all the walking no trouble sleeping. The hotel's location is probably its best asset. Drinks in the hotel bar were expensive. Continental breakfast ok but not really good. The availability of a sun terrace and small pool on the roof was nice however and we were able to catch a few hours in the sun after all the sightseeing. Fantastic cake shop on the corner of puerto del sol square. City tour bus really easy way to get off and see things, we enjoyed a trip around the Bernabau stadium that way. Stop across the road from the hotel, really easy. Very busy in the evenings, although thePlaza Mayor was lovely to visit and sit in at night. Food prices versus quality you find not great in the square itself. Down the side streets at the back resturants much more welcoming and spanish feeling. The supermacado of St stephens behind Plaza Mayor is a great busy and lively place to eat , drink or just people watch....

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel but central location”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Gill_Haslemere
Reviews.Content: Perfectly adequate. Room small, quite dark and unspectacular, but saved by good location and the pool and sun deck.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bet you can make use of the pool!”
Reviews.Author: Rene F
Reviews.Content: Stayed over for three nights and for two days the pool was closed as of 17.00 hours for weddings . And the worst thing is that we were not informed about this by the hotel when booking for this hotel. Also on the 1st day itself we were not informed, so when we came back after sightseing Madrid and wanted to make use of the pool, this was not possible. After a lot of guest complaint about this, they told us that tomorrow there would be another wedding!!; such a nice surprice (not...). The management told us that they couldn't do anything about this inconvenience and I was expecting a bit more customer service/client relation from a 4* hotel what they pretend to be. I must say the location is great, but the hotel has lot a bit of its glance....

Reviews.Title: “Inner city efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Nick D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the middle of everything in Madrid. Easy walking to most areas, although the excact location is a little down-market. Not at all dangerous or difficult to get around. The hotel will give you upgrades to very large Jr. Suites for not a lot of money, well worth it. Very clean and well maintained. Room service was efficient and good. The rooftop pool is nice for the warm weather, adn not over crowded. A good bargain, but I'd rate it at the lower end of teh 4 stars in Madrid primarily due to the location and limited front office services.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, roof top pool”
Reviews.Author: StevelCumbriaUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a weekend and this hotel was very good. It's location is spot on for shopping, only a short walk to the Plaza de Oriente and bus stops outside (make use of the tourist bus) and the metro across the street. The rooms are clean and ours was quite. There are some great bars and restaurants in Madrid so you won't need to eat here, however the breakfast is good. The real surprise is a roof top terrace and pool. We'll stay again the next time we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and roof terrace. Ideal Location.”
Reviews.Author: hbsource
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after my girlfriend and I got a Groupon voucher. It was extremely cheap and we were slightly concerned about what the hotel would be like. We were pleasantly surprised. We were anticipating a small (Groupon appropriate) room and that's what we got. It had a view of an adjoining building but it was clean and the bathroom was OK and the bed was comfy. So can't complain there. The location was brilliant. Near enough to all the action. A short walk to most of the centre and close to a metro line. Easily the best bit of the hotel is the big roof terrace and pool. The views are brilliant and the pool is a decent size and the drinks are (fairly) reasonable. It really makes a difference being able to see out the heat of the day sunbathing in a nice spot next to a pool. It really added to our city-break.

Reviews.Title: “Service Level Zero”
Reviews.Author: UncleSamDavid
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the airport by taxi. There is no porter at the Emperador and no-one helped us with our luggage. At Check-In, the receptionist greeted us with: "Passport, Credit Card!", wow, what a warm welcome! We made a few requests when booking on the Emperador website, simply none of them were recognized. We booked a junior suite, the room was spacious, well maintained and spotless clean. The room rate included access to what the hotel calls the "Club Emperador" with an alleged "open bar". In fact, it is a dark, provisional seperated area of what appeared to be an unused meeting room with a self-service minibar fridge and a very limited choice of no-name liquors. It doesn't even come close to the club levels of other hotels and it is not at all worth paying a higher rate. The rooftop pool was the main reason for booking this hotel, and we were not dissapointed. The service up here is very good, contrary to what we experienced in the other areas of the hotel. We travel a lot and we do understand that not everybody in the world speaks german. Therefore, we do communicate in english and I believe that is common standard pretty much all over the world, especially in the tourism industry. But when I was asking the receptionist a question in english, I got his answer in fluent spanish. Some people would consider this a rude behaviour - for us it is just one more example of the non-existing service level at the Emperador. We cancelled our stay after three nights and moved to a hotel that better fits our requirements. It was no surprise to us that at check-out nobody even bothered to ask why we were leaving early. They just don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very fancy and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel155
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Emperador hotel for a long weekend. First big advantage is that it is super accessible via metro and bus - the stops are right there. Madrid has a fantastic metro/subway network and traveling around is very easy and cheap. The Emperador is a few metres away from Gran Via, next to all the shopping. It is really in the very heart of Madrid. The staff was very service orientated and kind - we came back one night at 5:30 in the morning and our key did not work and they solved it right away. They held our luggage after checkout with no extra charge and simplified our problem with that, with a big smile. The rooms are very correct and good value for money. We had a mini bar, a tv, closets. Rooms very clean and cleaning lady very assiduous. Probably the only bad aspect about this hotel is that the breakfast is way too expensive (19 euro) . so don't take your breakfast here (we didn't) - the city is full of options so don't waste your money. I highly recommend this hotel and will be definitely returning !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: foxylady065
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel and had a swift check in by a friendly receptionist. Impressive spacious room on 6th floor. Fantastic roof top pool, excellent to have as we were there late August. Hotel is in an excellent location, we could walk to the majority of the main sights, also extremely easy to access the hotel by metro from the airport. Madrid as well was fabulous and the hotel made it an extra special trip.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: djanni11
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location and the roof top swimming pool. Only used the swimming pool once and for about 10 seconds as the water was freezing! It was June but what a disappointment ! The location is good but the atmosphere of the hotel radiates a kind of faded grandeur. We paid extra for a club room and expected a better standard accommodation, the really decor need up grading. The room was small overlooking Grand Via through a small window. In the club room you get nuts, crisps and ritz crackers. Soft drinks , beer on tap but no wine plus international papers Its not really worth the extra cost

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Pool”
Reviews.Author: danspetson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The first room offered was a small, dark double room ( 415 ), we had actually requested twin beds, due to a back complaint, so I asked to be moved, which was done quickly. We ended up in 709, much lighter room and more spacious. The pool is definately the best thing about the hotel. The staff round the pool and at the bar are very friendly & helpful, shame the same can not be said about the staff at reception ~ though that may be somewhat unfair, as it seemed to be only a couple of the reception staff that were distinctly aloof & unfriendly. The beds are nice and firm, though the pillows leave a little to be desired ~ no spares in the room, but rang down & requested some addtional cushions. The in room FREE safe was a bonus. Flat screen TV in room, with CNN & sky news. Can't comment on hotel food, we ate breakfast a couple of doors down at El Jamon, their spanish omelette & coffee breakfast was only €3 ~ bargain. ( though price went up on Sunday to €3.50?!) The tour bus is definately worth doing, though 2 days are probably not needed, we did both routes in 1 day. Plaza Mayor is a great area. Was very surprised about the area off Gran Via near Mcdonalds where there were lots of sex workers!! Though feels very safe & not particuarly seedy, great place to just sit watching the antics. The hotel is easy to find, we took the metro from the Airport, which is huge, clean & quiet ( similar size to Heathrow ), take train to Nuevos Ministerios, then change onto line 10 and get off and Plaza de Espana, a couple of minutes walk up the road to Hotel, don't bother trying to change for station at Santa Domingo, just not worth it, you can see hotel from Plaza De Espana ~ aim for Lion King theatre. Fare from Airport just €2.50 and less than 30 mins. The pool does get very busy in the afternoon, there are a few really comfortable rattan pieces of furniture - which are very sought after!! Wifi not free - approx €13 per day!! This is a business centre with 2 desktop PC's, but you have to pay to use these too!! However if you have your laptop, there is a starbucks nearby & Mcdonalds, which have FREE access. Basement Gym on site, has all the basics. Be warned - anyone wanting to park here, expect to pay nearly €30 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: teeby
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good hotel for families in a convenient location in Madrid, check out the Emperador Hotel. We are a family of 5 with two teenagers and a pre-teen. We were vacationing throughout Spain and stayed in Madrid at the Emperador in July 2011 for 5 nights. We had an nice stay. The Hotel Emperador is well located right on the Gran Via next to the Santo Domingo metro stop and near the Plaza de España. It is within walking distance or a short metro ride to many tourist attractions, shops, markets, theaters and restaurants. We walked or took the metro everywhere it was very easy to get around. There is a Starbucks right across the street and a VIPS convenience store about 2 blocks heading south east on the Gran Via. Some nearby attractions include the Plaza Mayor, Monasterio Descalzas Real and Palacio Real. Check out the Mercado San Miguel near the Plaza Mayor for a good eclectic local dining experience. The hotel is classical style. If you are looking for a modern hotel, this is not it. The rooms were clean and well furnished. We stayed in 2 club level rooms it was a little more per night, but we received access to the lounge which contains drinks and snacks and complimentary breakfast. The rooms were spacious, quiet, clean, well furnished, have nice bathrooms and AC. The breakfast was very good with a variety of items for all tastes and a chef for cook to order omelet’s or eggs. A great feature of the Hotel is the roof top pool and lounge! This is a great place to relax in the summer especially after long days of sightseeing with the kids. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby bar was nice as well. Wireless internet is available for a fee. If we return to Madrid we will definitely stay at the Emperador again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: GadaboutSolihull
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel in August 2011. The room (404) was small but clean. The (decent) bathroom was almost bigger than the room. There was no hot water on one day, due to a breakdown but this was fixed by the next day. The room's only 'view' was of a huge blank wall, but at least this meant that it was probably quieter than looking out onto the street. There are NO tea/coffee-making facilities, so take your travel kettle! There is a fridge, but ours wasn't working, although they replaced it very quickly. The very worst thing for me about this hotel was the pillows. They were as wide as the (twin) bed; about 10cm deep and about as comfortable as your average doorstep, which they closely resembled. The (unheated) roof top pool and sunbathing area are very pleasant. The location is as central as you could possibly get. Very busy shopping area, with lots of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, improvements in service needed”
Reviews.Author: theatremom
Reviews.Content: This property is centrally located, and there are many places within easy walking distance-Puerta del Sol, Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor. If you plan to focus your time at the three major museums (Prado, Thyssen, and Reina Sofia) you should consider another hotel closer to the museums. When we arrived, jet lagged and tired, the reception desk manager did not greet us. He was abrupt, and he did not even offer us a map. He did not give us a feeling of hospitality at all. The room however made up for his gruff manner. I am very glad we paid extra for the upgrade to a club room. The internet is NOT free; it costs an extra 13 euros per day. Breakfast is also not included. The upgrade to the club level will allow you to stop by the club lounge in the hotel for soft drinks, gin, draft beer, bottled water, peanuts, potato chips, and small crackers. The lounge does not offer wine. Drinks may not be taken out of the lounge. The hotel roof pool was popular. The hotel offers excellent and fast laundry service. The housekeeper picked up some items we needed washed and ironed, and everyhing was finished by the end of the day. Be aware that Grand Via is noisy, crowded, and there are homeless people who sleep on the street at night. The area is safe, just be aware that there are hotels on much quieter side streets and in plazas in Madrid. Some of them offer free amenities that the Emperador charges for.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - Pool is the only reason to stay here....”
Reviews.Author: gerryjets11
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel strictly for the pool , as we were on a family vacation in Madrid. We thought that due to the hot weather that it would be worth it. The pool was ok - unheated - and not child friendly. Definately not a 4 star hotel as it markets itself as. There was no conciege - just the front desk. And the beds were very uncomfortable. I was never greeted at the front desk upon check in and never asked how the stay was at checkout. The staff did not seem to care. I would not stay there again. Lastly, the ice cream bars for the kids were 4.5 e for one - which is about $7 - which is an outrage for a $2 bar - at most. Lastly, the wi-fi is NOT free - they charged 13 e per day. Lots of nice hotels - I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, plus a rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: AliRuth
Reviews.Content: Our choice of the Emperador for a four-night stay in Madrid was dictated by the roof top pool, which made our stay in this sunny city even better. The Emperador is in a fantastic central location on the Gran Via which gave us an easy walking distance to all the main attractions like the Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums (about a 10-15 minute stroll) plus tapas bars and restaurants in the Centro and Chueca districts. The lobby is very grand and impressive, and the buffet breakfast provided was fine - basic continental breakfast of cereals, fruit juices, yogurts, breads, toaster, plus cold meats, fruit, tortilla, tomatoes and cheeses. The choice was OK, not outstanding but enough to fill you up for the day ahead. There was a cooked breakfast bar area, but you had to pay extra or be eligible for the Emperador Breakfast Bar ticket. Having that obviously gave you more, and a better choice, but the standard buffet is fine really, Our room was clean, serviceable, and OK, but it was on the shady side of the hotel, and without a balcony so I have to say it was a little gloomy at times. In fact the blackout curtains meant we overslept on a couple of occasions and only just made it down to breakfast before everything ran out. Ours was just a standard room, and this is a city centre hotel, so we didn't really expect too much in the way of views or terrace, and for all the time we spent in the room it was fine really, although the pillows were a funny long thin shape which meant a couple of restless nights. The staff were friendly and helpful, and services like air conditioning standard. The city bus tours stopped virtually opposite the hotel on the other side of Gran Via, so really easy to buy tickets for and board. What really sold it to us was the rooftop pool and bar area. It was lovely up there, with a large pool for proper lengths, and proper sun loungers plus towels provided. It was great to have the option to soak up some sun in between hitting the streets for some sightseeing. The pool area got busier as the day went on, so it's worth getting up there early, but thankfully there was no need for any towel bagging sun loungers, there were enough for everyone. My one criticism was that there was limited shade available, and no umbrellas provided, so you have to be a real sun worshipper to brave it! But worth the trip up even just for lunch at the shady bar and the fabulous views over Madrid's city rooftops. For what it was (ie a city centre hotel, with no pretensions) the Emperador was fine, but the pool made it a great choice for us, as well as the central location. For restaurants we would recommend La Chata in Casa Baia (Centro) as authentically Spanish with great local food, and Barraca in Chueco for plentiful paella.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: nadso68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in July 11. Hotel foyer very marble and polished brass , cool clean and opulent. All communal areas clean and well cared for, carpets fresh and vacuumed thoroughly. Our standard room was lovely- granted the view wasn't much, overlooking the buildings to the rear of the hotel but the room was large with a little entrance hall and a quite lovely ensuite, again sparkling. Air con worked well but even in July didn't need it as room was cool. Mini bar reasonable.Beds quite hard though and only one pillow- not the most comfortable, but got used to it by third night. Rooftop pool stunning and gorgeous in the hairdryer heat of madrid in high summer. Plenty of sunbeds, decent sized deep pool, attentive waiters. Big, big big and only complaint about the hotel is about the excessive charges for drinks at the poolsode bar. A gin and tonic appeared to be 11 Euros- I say appeared because we couldn't afford to drink any. Had a couple of small beers and did the rest of our drinking in downtown Madrid. The poolside bar was popular abd had a lovely country club vibe about it and maybe this can only be sustained by the high drinks prices which prevents the riff raff like us from overdoing it, but noticed fellow Brits abstaining from the drinks. The poor exchange for the pound may have accounted for this.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on again”
Reviews.Author: cal204
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel and enjoyed it, so we went back. We stay in a Club Room and have never had any problems, view over the gran Via, loads of wardrobe space, Twin/King bed, shower pressure not great but this is not unusual. If I had a fault it would be that the Club room bar is not serviced enough, it is often messy and the fridge is often empty of drinks, also the draught beer was off for more than 24 hours. However, when you asked for a refil it is done, but should you have to ask? Pool is now open at 10am instead of 11 and it is wonderful up there, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous pool”
Reviews.Author: raydk
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights in mid july. Although the rooms were small, they were very clean, quiet, and the bathrooms were very good. The beds were a little too firm for me. The breakfast was a standard continental (fruit/pastries etc...) you had to pay extra for hot items (eggs/bacon etc). What made this hotel a great choice was its location (within walking distance of most tourist attractions in madrid) and the fabulous rooftop pool/bar. The pool was huge and there were many lounge chairs, with bar service at your chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: The Usual Suspect
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, I wasn't expecting a great deal from this hotel, but our purpose to visit was for Madrid, not the hotel! It is in an ideal location on Gran Via. Come out of the Metro station (Santa Domingo) look over your shoulder & there it is! We received a pleasant welcome (which is unusual according to recent reviews) & we were given all the info we needed on what our room basis covered. We upgraded to a Club room for 32 Euros per night (highly advisable as you get a quiet room which overlooks Gran Via, plus you get access to the hotel's Club Room which includes free local drinks). The breakfast is ok - if you eat a lot then you will be happy as the is a huge selection! I don't quite understand why boiled carrots were available though!!!! The roof top pool is delightful, can't say the same for the cafe or the service. I ordered Nachos for 6 Euros and received a plate of crisps with a cheese (I think it was cheese) sauce. I have to say, this hotel was perfect for what we wanted & if I returned to Madrid I would stay here again without hesitation. TOP TIP - if you have to get back to Madrid Airport for an early flight, the Metro doesn't start until 6am (& it took us about 40 mins to get from the airport to the hotel). Use a company called Aerocity - they charged us 27 Euros in total & got us to the airport in 20 mins. Excellent service & cheaper than the 70 Euros quoted for a taxis!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Madrid622
Reviews.Content: Hotel Emperador is an excellent hotel with exceptional service. It is conveniently located a few minutes walk from Plaza de Sol. Rooms are clean, nicely decorated and spacious. We accidentally left a fairly expensive item in the room when we checked out. It was found by the staff and returned to us. It was very easy to communicate with the hotel by email. I appreciated that hotel Emperador sent a confirmation email to me a few days before our trip. It seemed to be very well run.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....fantastic rooftop pool!”
Reviews.Author: Little_Travel_Bug_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my partner and his mother. We were visiting family who lived nearby in another part of the city. We opted for this hotel as we couldn't find any others within the same area with a swimming pool, so it stood out for us. We also liked the central location of the hotel. We booked two rooms, one for myself and my partner and the other for his mother. The lobby of the hotel is impressive and very clean and the reception staff were very welcoming. The two rooms were booked on the same floor which I was pleased with. Our first impression of the room was that it did lack space and was a little 'dated' but at least it was clean and comfortable. The bed could have also done with a couple of extra pillows as we only had one smallish pillow each. Initially I was very disappointed with the view as our room was at the back of the hotel and facing other rooms, however it actually became an advantage to us as the room was cooler, plus you didn't have the noise of people and traffic outside (every cloud and that). The food and drinks within the hotel were very pricey so we never ordered anything there. I'm not tight but do know the true price of things and it makes no sense to me to pay way over the odds for something that you could get the fraction of the price elsewhere. Thankfully, there was a Starbucks just across the road from the hotel which came in handy in the mornings and that was a lot cheaper, which I think is really telling you the expense of eating and drinking at the hotel. Although it is not unusual for hotels to have extortionate prices where their food and drink is concerned. The rooftop garden and pool was absolutely amazing and I think really makes this hotel. The swimming pool is huge and always kept clean and there are plenty of sunbeds to go around. Overall a pleasant stay for all of us concerned and I would certainly stay again, mainly due to the rooftop pool though :o)

Reviews.Title: “It had it's good points and it's bad”
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Emperador and had a lovely weekend, although this was due to the company more that the hotel. We arrived to be greeted by two surly men on reception, that were like the two moany guys on the balcony in the muppets! They finished what the were doing, before the even acknowledged we were standing there. When we asked about the advert on the reception desk for a club upgrade, it was like getting blood out of a stone, finding out what it included, so we decided to pass on this. We were not offered a porter to take the luggage (something that we are not too bothered about but you would normally expect in a 4 star), We walked into a dark shoebox of a room (bathroom was nice) and our friends room was even smaller. We decided to go back and view the club upgrade room which was far nicer and overlooking the Gran Via (with good soundproofing), we asked again what else it included and received a very grumpy response. The porter showed us to the room and was a breath of fresh air, he showed us the club area, where you can get soft drinks, beer and a rather odd choice of spirits, as well as nibbles, between 12 and 11pm. I would recommend upgrading because you will spend way more that 35 euros if you order drinks in the hotel. A litre of water being 9 Euros and a vodka (no mixer) 13 Euros. They say that you are not allowed to take your drinks out of the club room but we took them discreetly up to the pool and were never challenged. Top tip....take a bottle opener! Do not bother eating in the hotel, whilst it is not too expensive, it's not great and as soon as you have a drink with it, the price soars. Soft drinks were nearly 5 Euros. I ordered pizza with proscutto, it came out as margarita. When I pointed this out, they took it back and within minutes I had the pizza with processed cold ham thrown on top. Decided to put that down to experience and just not go back. Friend ordered nachos and for nearly 7 Euros, she was lucky enough to get a plate of doritos and some runny cheese. No salsa, guacamole, or any other garnish. Just squeezy cheese and chips. Service is not great, whilst they serve drinks by the pool, it takes some time to attract attention and then for them to arrive. The staff were very nice up there but just not very effective. On a positive note, the pool was lovely and so were the views from the 10th floor and the hotel is perfectly situated in the middle of most things, with the tour bus stopping just across the street. We grabbed coffee and breakfast from Starbucks each morning, which is right across the road and a damn sight cheaper! You will also need to be up on the roof terrace to bag your lounger with a towel before midday or risk not getting one, particularly at the weekend. This is because the hotel allow non residents to use the facilities for 44 Euro. Not a problem if you're successful with getting a sunbed but something I would have been annoyed about had I not, which did happen to those wanting to sunbathe in the afternoon on Saturday and Sunday. If you want internet access, pop across the road for free wifi in McDonalds as you will pay 13.95 euros for a day in the hotel. We had a lovely weekend and the rooms were clean with a nice bathroom but I would not rush back to this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suite which was perfect with a balcony. The location was perfect.. Their breakfast was was very good. Their club or VIP suite was poorly staffed and we had to request 2 times to stock . The swimming pool was a beautiful setting but 90% of the people there were males of an alternative sexual preference. This made it too uncomfortable to use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Well....it's an OK hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: ZAIDYY
Reviews.Content: First things first...location is great!....Hop off the plane, hop in the metro, change line, hop off metro, get out and turn back, there is the Emperador! The hotel is right in the heart of the shopping district, lots and lots of shops restaurants, theaters, etc... Palacio Real is 10 minutes walk (make sure you visit this on Wednesday when they change the royal guards). The hotel itself is fine. However, I could not help but feel that staff were snobby. in addition; when you book a room with breakfast you get the intercontinental breakfast (no ham, bacon, eggs,etc...). You must pay extra for the EMPERADOR BREAKFAST, this is a rip-off in my book. Our room was clean and the mini bar was full of goodies. but like every other hotel I stayed in while in Spain, the only English channels were CNN (which kept going off despite the fact that I complained about this), and Sky News (only useful if you're English/British or into UK news). To sum up: I loved the location but I don't think I will go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and what a surprise on the roof!"”
Reviews.Author: Jude96
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking from the metro station after taking the train from the airport. No need for taxis! Three of us in a room and the one who had the sofa bed was happy with his lot. Room was spot on although it was better to keep the blinds shut as the view was only other peoples rooms. However, as the only time spent in the room was mostly taken up by snoring the view wasnt a problem. Breakfast was good,everything available in big room and the big round tables in the far corner are a great location if there is a group of more than 4. Grab one! Location for Madrid centre is excellent. Tour bus stops outside altough difficult to get on as very few get off at this stop! We only found out on the last morning about what was up on the roof. Superb swimming pool, stunning views across the city, sun loungers, drinks bar, food availalable. Great hotel. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Madrid and the Emperador Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We were 5 ladies on a weekend trip. We loved the Emperador Hotel, rooms had connecting door, which meant we were together for whole weekend. Staff were very helpful, breakfast great and rooms very clean. The roof top terrace and pool was great for cocktails and nibbles. We asked for some recommendations for dinner. Midnight Rose was one of them and I cant recommend them highly enough. Food, service, ambience fantastic. We were also recomended Ginger, all I can say is DONT GO THERE!! staff were arrogant, and from the minute you walk in they are rushing you to get out, give this a miss!! Madrid is a lovely city and I would recommend the tour bus for getting your bearings. Fab Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KnoxE
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Madrid to celebrate our friend's birthday. We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. So much so we have booked to return in August 2011. The hotel is very comfortable and we especially enjoyed the roof top garden and the swimmong pool just what we needed in the warm weather, Can't wait to be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Horrible room (pictures)”
Reviews.Author: deharts
Reviews.Content: We booked a year in advance for May 2010. Booked through American express, using points. We talked to Hotel Emperador directly several times months in advance. We arrived the hotel looked slightly dated compared to U.S. Hotels but lobby was very nice. Arrive at the room/box #804 it was horrible I thought they gave us the janitors closet or the staffs break room, rest area. The room was very smelly that old musty smell. We went back down to the front desk and ask for a better room and was told that was all they had. Later that evening a tour bus checked in. The room was very small and had two small beds that were the size of cots, that came up to my knee in height, both headboards old and very scratched. The room had to be 9x12, there was a bed against the left wall then a night stand and the second bed against the right hand wall (wide as a jail cell) If you wanted to open the window (inward) you would have to move the chair, and then you could not see the TV from the bed because the curtain would block the view. The closets were small musty, and the false floor and ceiling of the closet were tweaked enough that you could see below and above. We did not unpack our clothes. The 19in. TV was propped on top of mini fridge at the foot of the bed which blocked you from fully opening the closets thank goodness we did not used them. The one sitting chair was stained and broken. The desk was also beat up and scratched, the carpet soiled. I have pictures of all these claims. The bathroom was clean but very dated as well, dark brown tile and fixtures and florescent lighting. I can go on and on, but its best to end here. I did see better rooms in the hotel, but supposedly we could not get.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: boxochocolate
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night. the location was perfect for going to the palacio and wandering around the puerta del sol area. we didn't do the hotel breakfast but there were great breakfast spots nearby. the room was SMALL. but we were prepared for that. it was comfortable though, and the bathroom was fine with good amenities. they gave us a bottle of champagne for free which was nice. the rooftop pool and bar area are really nice, great views. a good place to stay for a short sightseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, hotel is ok”
Reviews.Author: scottyccfc
Reviews.Content: Right the location is brilliant, when you first walk in the hotel does look top notch! Once you make it to the rooms though it is very basic, it reminds me of a hotel room youd see on TV shows back in the 80s. Its basic, the view is shocking (Depending on what side of the hotel you are on) 8 of us went over and we were put on different floors (Obviously thinking we were a stag or someting) The pool was closed when we were there but Madrid itself is a great City so the room didnt really matter. Basically if you are a youg couple/group of friends under 30 this wont matter, its a hotel room with a great location. if you want luxury stay well away. Would I stay again? Yeah sure, it was cheap and no frills.

Reviews.Title: “SoSo hotel”
Reviews.Author: erinm51
Reviews.Content: This was a middle of the road hotel. The hotel is an older hotel wich is fine and can be charming, but our room was tiny and no frills at all, The bathroom was the nicest part of the room. The staff was o.k and the location was nice. The hotel was not great and was not bad it was just an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nyudad
Reviews.Content: we just finished our tour of Spain which included Madrid. This hotel was a disappointment aft our stay in a Hilton in Barcelona. The staff was not very friendly. The room was old but decent size. However there was no clock in the room or an iron or coffee maker . The other hotels during our stay were able to provide us with converters for U.S. Plugs.The staff here basically shrugged and said had none and we could buy some from the store next door. the beds were very uncomfortable. the only plus I will give this hotel is it's location. It really is near most major attractions and you can walk to almost everything.However while walking we spotted many other hotels that were also nearbythat you can stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with lovely rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: CSHH
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Emperador in July 2010 and would definitely return. We booked a club room as there were three of us and it was very comfortable with plenty of room- no balcony though as others have mentioned. There were tea & coffee making facilities in the room. It is worth paying a little extra for a club room as access to the club lounge was a real bonus. We were disappointed, however, by the noise level on the night of a wedding party taking place in the hotel. The noise in our room stopped us from sleeping & when we called reception at 2am we were advised that the wedding party would go on until 3am. The problem seemed to be that our room was directly above the function room. They did offer to move us to a different room for the night but at 2am we didn't fancy the upheaval! Other than this we were happy with our stay at the Emperador. The larfge rooftop pool was lovely- especially after a day of very hot sightseeing. A highlight has to have been watching the world cup final in the clubroom with other guests then heading out to to soak up the atmosphere after Spain had won- fantastic! We would definitely return to the Emperador but would check whether there were any functions planned!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the heart of the tourist area”
Reviews.Author: Gokulram_Arunasalam
Reviews.Content: Gokulram Arunasalam The hotel is in the central part of the city on the Gran Via and right by all the shopping.and tourist attractions. The rooms are really nice with all amneties. The hotel also has a spa and pool, so it truly deserves its star rating.

Reviews.Title: “good solid hotel, rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: teritravels2010
Reviews.Content: The lobby is lovely, the staff helpful. The room was a decent size, but the third bed was a pullout coach, which they did add an extra mattress to - which made a huge difference. Madrid has very few "triples" - and expedia advertised it as such, but it was really a double with an extra bed. They upgraded us (I think?) to a junior suite, which made the room a fine size. The windows were pretty good, but even with that, we were awakened by sirens and singing in the street -which is not the hotel's fault, of course. The bathroom was quite nice and well appointed. Nice big towels and robes. No complaints, at all...just needs upgrading, but for the price of $233 for the three of us, I suppose, a decent deal. I personally don't love the Gran Via area as it's so busy.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive and not so-modern hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Doursou
Reviews.Content: Hotel Emperador is a "grand hôtel": its location is perfect, and it has an elegant hall. However, the hotel is definitely expensive. At least 80 euros per room, and Internet is not free (you have to pay 5 or 6 euros for 30 minutes!). Also, the breakfast is not always included, and it costs 15 euros per person: 15 euros for having bad coffee, some scambled eggs and low-quality cheese and tasteless pastry and fruits... Moreover, the hotel staff does not speak English neither French, which is a real problem if you are not Spanish-speaker. Furthermore, in the rooms, you don't have a lot of choice of TV programs; almost all the channels are in Spanish... Nevertheless, this hotel has an excellent location, on Gran Via, Madrid's Champs Elysées/ 5th Avenue! Five minutes from the hotel by walk, you have the "Puerta del Sol", the center of Madrid. If you don't want to walk, you have always a lot of taxis near the hotel. But you also need only five minutes to go by walk from the hotel to the "Chueca", the very trendy district of Madrid where everybody is going out at night (in fact, it is the gay district, and all the bars and nightclubs - for gay and straight people - are there). By the way, if you are a clubber or nightlife-fan, the best club of Madrid, the Club Cool, is just behind the hotel... Finally, if you consider the location as an important thing during your trip, Hotel Emperador remains a pretty good deal, because everything is close when you are there. Avoid the breakfast at the hotel: there is a Starbucks just in front of Emperador, or you can try the place "Paradiso Jamon", which is a restaurant and a ham store but also a typical coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: The rooftop pool is terrific. We had a room with a balcony looking on the Gran Via that we found was a bonus in a city hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: johnsty
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Madrid on December 30th to spend 4 days over the New Year with my wife. The hotel is located right on the Gran Via and is easily accessable from the Airport using the Metro system which involved one change and cost the princely sum of 2 Euros, as there some steps to negoiate at the Metro stations it is probably not advisable if you are carrying large cases. The reception staff at the hotel were excellent and although I speak a little Spanish it was not necessary as all the staff are fluent in English and are very helpful. We had booked a Junior Suite and we were not disapointed, the room was a corner suite overlooking the Gran Via and it was huge, very clean and exceptionally well appointed with all the amenities you would expect at a top class hotel. We had breakfast a couple of mornings at the hotel as this was part of our package and found the food to be adequate, although I do not think I would pay the 18 Euros asked as there are numerous places on Gran Via which offer breakfast at half the price. Having booked a suite we had access to the Emperador lounge which proved to be a bonus as it was usually very quiet and one could just sit quietly and read the daily papers,only moan about the lounge was that they did not serve wine!!! only exec lounge I have been in any where in the free world which did not offer this facility, drinks on offer were whisky, gin a couple of liquers and plenty of soft drinks and water so if you are looking for some free vino you are out of luck at this hotel. Getting around about Madrid is very simple due to the ecellent Metro system which is very easy to understand. All in all the hotel provided an excellent retreat from the madness that is Madrid over the new year period and I would recommend the Emperador to anyone intending to visit this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and breakfast, but it is pricey :)”
Reviews.Author: busytraveller2008
Reviews.Content: Service from all the staff was fantastic, lovely breakfast for room service but it wasn't cheap. Great location and good sized room. Shame the room terrace and pool was closed (although it was December) would have made it even more excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Drafty rooms! Don't stay here in Winter”
Reviews.Author: Mouglie
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great location (near the theater) district, and is close to the Metro stop. Also the hotel folks are nice. That's about the best I can say about the hotel. The rooms however clean were very drafty. They have central air but no humidifier. So during the night the rooms were cold on one side, warm on the other and very very dry. Not a good combination for winter. Also the rooms filled up with cigarette smoke during the mornings and eve, we requested for a non smoking room and were told that there aren't any. Also with the rooms near the street were noisy though out the night and we never got good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Smells like sewer”
Reviews.Author: clam1230
Reviews.Content: This was one hotel that I feel my fellow TripAdvisors failed me. I booked this hotel based on the others' great reviews, and was definitely disappointed! I had wanted a nice, clean, 4 star hotel to end the last 3 days of our trip, but... When we checked in, we were asked if we wanted to upgrade our room for another 20 EUR. We declined, and I feel like we were given the worst room available. The room was so small that when you open the door, the bed is right there. There was barely any room to place our luggage. What's worst though is the sewage smell that was so foul and instantly noticeable upon opening the door! It felt so disgusting, but it was late afternoon and we were anxious to take advantage of the last few daylight hours on the rooftop pool. So we turned on the AC in the room and went up to the pool. Luckily, upon returning, the AC helped clear the smell. We suspect that the room hasn't been occupied in a long time (hence, again, the suspicion that our decline to the upgrade led us to this unused closet of a room). This room also didn't feel very clean. The carpet feels very dirty, and the bathroom is very old. There's a loose tile on the floor that creaks everything you walk on it. The only positive amenity to this hotel is the rooftop pool, although I wish they'd add a hot tub since there is such a large space available. Service is also poor. I found the staff to be very snobby. Also, during our check-out, we asked the front desk to check which terminal our airline flies out of, as they're pretty far stops on the subway. He told us the wrong one, so we arrived 1/2 hour later. Luckily, we're the types that like to arrive 3 hrs early to the airport! Plus, they charge additional for internet which should be standard by my book for a "4-star" hotel. Overall, I would definitely not recommend this place. Go to the Best Western (3-star) instead!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dingy Rooms, but all forgiven as Roof Terrace was superb”
Reviews.Author: adventurecalls
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights & spent most of our time on the roof terrace - really lovely spot to lounge in the sun by the pool. A real treat as the hotel is centrally located, on a busy main road. Rooms had very little natural daylight - so were uninspiring, but comfortable. Drinks on the Roof Terrace horrendously expensive - 12 euros for 2 small bottles of Sprite - beware!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - amazing roof”
Reviews.Author: Archie2004
Reviews.Content: Can absolutely recommend this hotel. The location is excellent and the swimming pool on the roof is amazing. Good atmosphere in overall. Buffet breakfast was ideal for the start of the day. Enjoy a cocktail and the view on the roof terrace - don´t miss it! Good drinks, good service - a perfect place for hanging around.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city, on Gran via”
Reviews.Author: martandrews
Reviews.Content: Centrally located and not too bad in quality, the Emperador Hotel is a good and relatively cheap choice for your stay in Madrid. The rooms are not that spacious, but nicely decorated and clean. We just had the problem, that one night after returning from dinner, the electronic door lock did not work anymore, so we had to be relocated. Big plus: The large rooftop Pool!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL, GREAT POOL, EASILY DESERVE'S 5*”
Reviews.Author: GlowballChester_UK
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my partner and 5 year son (wheelchair user) in July. We can not fault this hotel on anything at all. Our room was always spotlessly clean after returning room breakfast, clean bedding, towels, toiletries etc. The staff were friendly and always willing to help with directions, ordering taxi's, language difficulties and supplying fresh milk 4 my little boy. The pool was much needed in the 40degree heat and always clean with fresh towels supplied and life guard on duty at all times. We will be returning to this hotel again on our next trip 2 madrid. More than deserves 4* rating!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with decent location”
Reviews.Author: Vinegarhill
Reviews.Content: Not a great deal to say other than it being in a decent location, nice clean and large room. I was pleasantly surprised by Madrid and enjoyed a great weekend with friends.I enjoyed the more traditional taps type bars.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to book a room at the Emperador next time we're in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Michael969
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful (especially the bottle of Cava on ice that came to our room, compliments of the hotel). The location is excellent - only a few steps from the Santo Domingo metro station entrance on the Gran Via and within easy walking distance to the Plaza Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Plenty of good places to eat nearby (we kept getting drawn back to Chocolatería Valor for the fruit and chocolate fondue ... Also had a great meal and listened to live Cuban music at a place called Cuando Salí de Cuba just a few blocks away). Lots of interesting shopping on nearby pedestrian-only streets with shade covers overhead. As some have noted, the rooms are not huge, but I wouldn't deem the Club rooms we had small (We stayed twice, once at the beginning of our trip and once at the end). We were quite comfortable, the rooms were very clean both visits and neither had any odor of smoke at all. We also enjoyed the view from our window over the Gran Via. Room service menu was a bit pricey. We also liked the fact that we could get information about things to do before we arrived by becoming fans of the Emperador's Facebook page. One other tip, the taxi ride to and from the airport should cost 25 to 30 euros. Any more and you've been scammed. Ask the fare before you get in the cab.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt want to come home :(”
Reviews.Author: cal204
Reviews.Content: We arrived 2 hours late after delays at the London airport and were glad to arrive, we got off at Plaza de Espana Metro which is a 3 minute walk to the hotel and cuts out an extra train change and escalators are great when you have luggage, there are no escalators at Santo Domingo.... We were welcomed in a very friendly way by the reception and shown directly to our Club Room on the 4th floor, wonderful views over the Gran Via from out balcony, we were given a double room and we found the bed to be very small, we do have a kingsize bed at home though, the next day I asked to switch rooms with a bigger bed and this was done without hassle. The Club room was great has a place to escape from the hussle and bussle and the free bar was a godsend with the euro being so low... We had a huge flatscreen TV with Skynews but no other channels but lucky for us we dont go on holiday to watch TV. Tea and Coffeee was available in our room and was replenished everyday. We didnt have breakfast included but I went for Breakfast one morning and enjoyed what I had, however my hubby who enjoys a cooked breakfast would have been dissapointed so we didnt go to breakfast again, I used to nip across the road for a Starbucks and a pain au chocolat..... When you come out of the Hotel and turn right and cross the first crossing, do not use the first cashpoint you come to, we did on the last night of out holiday and the machine swallowed my card and didnot dispence my 100euro, lucky enough I bank with FD in the UK and they made sure I was returned my money, I went into the "Bank" the next morning and it didnt even look like a bank inside and they showed no interest in my problem. Make use of the Rooftop pool it is fab and only gets busy on the weekends, the food up there is not cheap but it is not overpriced and it is really good, Overall a fab holiday all round.....

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: cocotwice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about Location, Location, Location and a rooftop pool. We got a great rate including breakfast and wanted to be in the city centre with access to a pool so it was perfect for us. However if either of those things are not important to you there are much better hotels to stay in. The location is superb - you are right on Gran Via the main thoroughfair in the city - think Picadilly Circus if you are staying in London. So you are walking distance of EVERYTHING you need to see. Tourist bus stops opposite and you are directly next to a choice of metro stations too. Literally LOADS of restaurants in walking distance, gorgeous Tapas places on pedestrianised streets, walking to Plaza Mayor or steps from the hotel to the Spanish offshoot of 'Pizza Express' (come out turn left) or opposite that is TGI Fridays if you are unadventerous. There is no tea and coffee making in the room so you'll appreciate the Starbucks that is opposite! I found the check-in staff really rude and obnoxious - no eye contact, no conversation, didnt even give the key to me or speak to me - gave the key to the bell boy and walked off! Very rude! The breakfast staff were good and the breakfast buffet was excellent - the addition of a chilled bottle of Cava (not champagne as others have said) was a lovely way to start the day. Mixed with peach juice for a Bellini or OJ for a Bucks Fizz was a lovely way to start the day every day. The room is definately 3 star, very basic with small windows and low ceilings nothing special at all but the food and choice was excellent every morning. The pool was fantastic, it is so high up that you look out over the other buildings and statues - it is one of the most lovely pools we've been in - it was such a welcome relief after a hard day of sight seeing to jump in the pool. Towels provided and lots of loungers available. Do check it is open when you are going though as you will be disappointed if it is shut when you go. If you want to hire a car the hotel is directly opposite an AVIS shop which was very handy for us, we had hired a car for the next leg of our journey but decided to pick it up a few days later from the office opposite the hotel rather than paying the extortiante amount to park the car in the hotel. You really do NOT need a car when you stay here as you can get public transport everywhere. Even getting a cab from the airport in rush-hour worked out cheaper than paying parking! The rooms are ok, nothing special, comfortable rooms with nice comfy beds, TVs (nothing english), safe, big bathroom etc. But be warne, the most important thing to say when you check in is "Last time I stayed the room had a terrible smell, please make sure I do not have a smelly room". The woman checking in next to me said this and I'm sure she was fine - our room had a weird mixture of bad drains and air freshner trying to disguise it! I had read on Trip Advisor about the smelly rooms but didnt think it woudl be a problem - but it's not great, We were on level 5 in a room looking into a dark atrium in the middle of the hotel and the room had an odd drain smell - worse in the afternoon. We were only spending 3 nights and were out most of the time so it didnt really bother us but if you were staying any longer or had a sensitive nose do ask for a non smelly room. I think it's just poor drainage - it's not really awful but not too pleasant. If you want to be in the middle of everything and you want to be able to swim then this should be your first choice if you can get a good rate, if you dont need to swim there are better hotels on Gran Via and further out of the area for cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool - great location - pay extra for clubroom”
Reviews.Author: piboBelgium
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the location of this hotel can't be better (central on the gran via) and the pool rooftop is really great. It's really worth to pay a bith extra for a club room, which gives access to a free bar and which all have balconies and views over the gran via. Only negative point was that I was not impressed about the quatilty of the beds. I really liked this hotel, which has a nice old fashion feel, and will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Faultless service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fjvdberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Emperador over Gay Pride weekend - a very busy time for any hotel in Madrid! On check-in (14:30) we were greeted by very friendly reception staff. We were told to wait a bit as a double, non-smoking room was not available at the moment. After we had waited about 10 min, one of the reception staff came over and told us we had been upgraded to a junior suite with a view over Gran Via! Our weekend could not have started any better. The room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom was huge and had all the amenities one could ask for. The double window system worked extremely well in keeping outside noise to a minimum. The room's airconditioning system worked really well - a necessity in Madrid during summer! The selling point for this hotel is the amazing rooftop pool and bar - we spent a lot of time sunning ourselves on the loungers. The pool bar staff were incredibly friendly despite being very busy and hot. Location wise, this hotel cannot be beaten. It's right on the Grand Via with all it's shops and restaurants, moments away from a few Metro stops and within a 10 min walk of Chueca district. We had a wonderful stay at the Emperador and would certainly stay there again if we go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: seavue
Reviews.Content: I spent far too long agonising over which hotel to go to for our three night city break. Thank goodness I chose Hotel Emperador! Seconds away from metro (Santo Domingo on red line) Across the road from stop no 19 for the Madrid Vision bus. Easy walking distance to the Royal Palace (go on Wednesday with EU ID and get in free) Museo del Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia and all the Plazas and restaurants. We didn't get the travel pass advised by many as it was so easy to walk everywhere. Nor did we get taxi from airport as even with a metro strike apparently going on we still found it so straightforward to get to and from the hotel (1 euro each plus 1 euro airport tax). Probably proper luggage would make it trickier. Hotel Emperador has a stylish lobby, deliciously cool, with very helpful staff who all seem to speak good English. Our room (on seventh floor) was perfect - marble bathroom - TV (could only get Sky news but too much to see outside). Very efficient but quiet air con. Our room had balcony overlooking side road but with two layers of double glazing doors could not hear anything. I booked through hotel as prices on other sites seemed same and so felt better actually speaking to the hotel and asking that, as well as non-smoking, we would appreciate a room with a view. They can't promise but try asking as we later noticed some of rooms seem to look onto a brick wall which might not be so nice. Breakfast was good - plenty of choice. Room was always immaculate when we returned from our museum trail. Probably all this applies to any one of other 4* hotels in the area BUT - no other hotel has a swimming pool (and I do mean swimming not splash) on its top floor! This made all the difference to our trip. Spend the day seeing remarkable paintings and palaces and walking round Madrid In 33+degrees and then scoot up to the roof - pick up your burgundy beach towel and dive into that lovely, clean, swimming pool and then chill on a lounger and read or people watch! Perfect combination. I would absolutely recommend this hotel - such a relief that I made the right choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: smokietown
Reviews.Content: For our Girls weekend - perfect. We enjoyed our 4 night stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly & helpful, the hotel was clean & comfortable. The pool on the roof was an added bonus especially as the weather was really good. The location was perfect and once you familiarise yourself with the area, there are an abundance of local cafes & restaurants. The Metro is easily accessible as is the Madrid tour bus that stops directly across from the hotel. A great city to walk around. Fantastic sightseeing & great shopping. Can't wait to go back another time.

Reviews.Title: “Cool rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: Tsimmi-O
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a classy city hotel, interiors are a bit aged and retro romantic but ok. The best is the roof top pool in the middle of the city! Very high up! 10th floor. Water was very chilly but clean and actually quite refreshing on a hot day in May! Food and drinks are available from the pool bar, lounge music coming from the speakers. The pool area is spacious with many sunbeds, the pool is quite big. It is not very stylish though, green plastic grass floor, green plastic chairs and the view from the rooftop is not very spectacular, metal fences all arround and the surrounding buildings are also very high, blocking the view. Drinks & Food quite expensive too. Rooms are classic/retro and quite clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Emperador - beach on the top of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Loslapillos
Reviews.Content: I was searching a good hotel in Madrid for city weekend with my wife in Madrid. I accidentally hit a hotel in Barcelona by the beach and it looked so great I almost reserved it. Wait a minute, there is no see in Madrid. I got an idea. Maybe there is a hotel that has a pool in the downtown Madrid. I found few hotels with pool but the only one has the pool on the 10th floor and top - Hotel Emperador. We had a fantastic weekend in Madrid: great food and wine, art museums and shopping without kids. Metro is very useful and cheap but we walked our feet off. The best part of our short vacation was Hotel Emperador. My idea was great. After lunch we came back to hotel and changed to swimsuits. Up tp the 10th floor and we were in different place - at the beach. Of course it was perfect to have beach weather but we had city and beach weekend in Madrid. I was not expecting that when my wife took me to Madrid so spend time together before her conference on Monday. Hotel is a little old but very clean well kept. Staff is friendly. Room was nice but we did not like the carpet because it makes us sneeze. It was worth the money anyway, but the pool area made it superb .

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rullestenen
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and pleasant service. What more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, old rooms and some smelled...”
Reviews.Author: t0309999
Reviews.Content: The rooms were too dark and old. needs remodelling. Breakfast was great. Great location and walking distance to everything, one of the rooms we had smelled but the hotel is old.

Reviews.Title: “If you like smelly hotels this is your place”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_Sadie
Reviews.Content: Oh TripAdvisor, you let us down. This hotel was the worst place we stayed in during our honeymoon to Madrid, Sevilla, Ronda, Nerja and Granada. This is NOT a 4 star hotel. The floor we were on smelled horribly and the linens are so shabby. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The lobby was always filled with smokers and the hotel staff never greeted us. We even arrived home one evening to find our room door open/unlocked....it hadn't been secured by the housekeeping staff. My husband called downstairs to inform them about it and they apologized but that was about it. Luckily all of our stuff was still intact. The neighborhood it is in is quite questionable...the store a couple of doors down was robbed one morning while we were heading out. We were trying to save a couple of dollars and wished we hadn't. The pros about the place: in-room safe, close to a couple of metro stations, the pool if you are visiting in the summer is apparently nice. Cons: service, linens, room size was the smallest we stayed in while in Spain, the smell, shabby condition of the decor and rooms, internet access was about 4 euros for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: scrapycow
Reviews.Content: Was slightly concerned about staying here as I had read mixed reviews. When we arrived the entrance hall was very nice, and the room was great. Although the hotel is slightly dated, it is still luxurious and a fantastic place to stay. The service was second to none, and the room we were in was lovely, with a balcony over the grand via and a great club room with free drinks and snacks. Upon arrival there was a bad smell in the room, but as soon as i mentioned it to reception they moved us into a different room up one floor. It was fantastic and i can highly recommend a stay here. the breakfast was great too with free champagne.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MartaL
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through a high quality Spanish travel agency (Viajes El Corte Ingles) and though they don't work with hotels not reaching a particular standard I was a bit scared after reading some of the reviews here. We intend to visit Madrid next July with some friends so I was looking for a hotel with exterior swimming pool as Madrid in summer is hot as hell. We decided to spend a long weekend in Madrid to visit some friends and booked the Emperador to check if it would be ok for our summer trip. On my arriving someone helped me at the main door with my luggage and waited nearby while I checked in and helped again to the room. The room was perfectly ok (I've added some photographs), with a double bed, a sofa, a smal armchair, minibar, tv and desk. In the corridor (with a door to separate from bedroom) there's a wardrobe with a safe and a rack for suitcase. The bathroom was big enough, clean and not cold. I didn't actually touch the radiator but temperature in the bathroom was ok. It wasn't a bedroom with a view as it was an interior one but I prefer to be away from the noisy Gran Via anyway. There're no ironboard or coffe/tea facilities as it's not usual in Spain (same as very rarely hotels in UK have a minibar). We didn't tried the bar but it looked a quiet and nice area to have a drink and a chat. The swimming pool was obviously closed at this time of the year but we were given all kind of explanations to our enquiries for our future staying. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel and we used to have it at VIPS nearby. I like this hotel and we definitely will be back in July. The only negative remark is that it's not soundproofing at all (the door between the actual bedroom area and the door to the main corridor helps but we had a couple of German guys next door and they arrived late at night (3ish), quite drunk and noisy so it was quite annoying).

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DMadB
Reviews.Content: Has been a real good time. Nice Bar with free drinks, Sauna and a swiming pool on top of the building. Located at Gran Via. Good to reach all famous places by foot or METRO

Reviews.Title: “very mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: JoCoiner
Reviews.Content: I'm astonished at the hotel manager's response to the Florida couple's complaint about the non-existing heating in the bathroom, since we experienced exactly the same. There is a small radiator under the sink which didn't work. The room is heated by the air-condition system but not very effectively either. There was one exceptionally polite and helpful older receptionist after my terrible state of having been robbed on the tube while traveling from the airport to the hotel. He called the police and the credit card agents. The other personnel was rather impolite and hardly noticed one. The breakfast quality was pretty plain and below a four-star hotel standard in my opinion. I think there are better places to stay when in Madrid. Even the situation of central in the sense of being right in the bustling Gran Via doesn't compensate for the coldness of this place.

Reviews.Title: “How can this hotel be a 4 star???”
Reviews.Author: Buitre03
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights from 10/20 through 10/22. I was very disappointed at the service. This is considered a 4 star hotel but the service was absent. We walked through the lobby multiple times and nobody said hi to us. The room was too small and the bathroom was very cold. The heat only worked in the bedroom. Only the location was great. When we checked out, I asked the front desk cashier to call us a cab to the airport and she told me to wait for coworker to come back. We had to walk outside in the cold and wait for a taxi to drive by. This is not a 4 star hotel. It should be a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Big Room, Noisy Street”
Reviews.Author: marcigami
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my two friends to Madrid, we are all in past thirty but not close to 50 years of age. We decided to stay at the Emperador Hotel for one very simple reason, we were going to be there during Aug and Sept and needed a pool. This was the only hotel is a great location with a pool. And if you are planning to be in Madrid during the hot summer months than you definitely need to stay here. The pool is amazing. It is located on the roof of the hotel and you can see the whole city 360 degrees. Sure there is a fake green grass look and the chairs are a bit cluttered but all in all the pool area is great. I did not order from the bar but instead brought my own booze in a bag and asked for a glass of ice. Not that I am cheap but lets face it, Madrid is not cheap. So lets start from the beginning. Got off the airplane, took forever to get baggage, followed the signs down to the metro and purchased the 10 ride pass. You so need to do this if you plan to get around Madrid. The metro system is off the hook! We never waited more than a minute for a train. Okay so the metro guy told us to get off at Plaza de Espana, but since I am a librarian and think I know everything I decided to get off at Santo Domingo. NOTE: THERE ARE NO ESCALATORS AT SANTO DOMINGO. YOU WILL NEED TO CARRY ALL YOUR LUGGAGE UP THE STAIRS! AND THERE ARE SO MANY STAIRS. However you end up being right in front of the hotel. If you care to get off at Plaza de Espana, they have escalators and it is a two block walk. The metro starts running at 6 am FYI. Check in: Great, they gave us a room up high and we were on our way. Now we expected it to be an old hotel and were expecting the worst. We had a triple room and were extremely worried that we would be cramped. Not at all! The room had two closets, a safe, a hallway, and the beds were all spaced accordingly. There was a desk, a sitting chair and several furniture pieces for clothing items. The bathroom was large and there were plenty of towels. The room was very clean. We left every morning very early because it was a non stop action and when we returned mid day our room was always clean. I have super bad sinuses and need to sleep with the window open rather than the air on, and if you plan to do this you need EARPLUGS. It is so loud on the street. We would get in around two or three in the morning, and people in Madrid are out until the sun rises. They love to honk their horns, scream, and have a good time. Earplugs are needed. But if you can sleep with the windows shut then you will be fine. The location in on the Gran Via, and about four blocks to the right when you exit the lobby is Corte Ingles. On the very bottom floor, the basement, Corte Ingles has a supermarket, so go there to buy all your snacks and wine and gifts to bring home. I bought tons of sausages home. And of course ham. Follow the metro map and you can get anywhere. The hotel is in a great location and I would definitely stay here again. Starbucks across the street, VIPs nearby, KFC across the street and tons of Spanish eateries.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and close to shoping street”
Reviews.Author: rene1293
Reviews.Content: i stay in this hotel 5 days, very nice hotel . very close to the metro ,close to the shopping street and restaurant . room are nice and clean. staff are good. the breakfast is good. i advice every one who visit madrid , use the metro to "discover" Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: 3Hunts
Reviews.Content: I really loved this 4 star hotel, great location within walking distance to major attractions and great food places. We took a taxi to and from the airport as we didnt want to be traipsing around with a LO of 16 months. The only thing i could complain about is the breakfast for the price was a bit samey and limited each morning, .more variety would have been great - ie they only had 2 types of egg and bacon on offer for warm food. and the fruit was the same every day. The room was a good size for us including a cot bed We stayed in room 138 which gave us a side view with a balcony. The rooftop pool was fabulous and very relaxing, good sunspot and lovely loungers

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shuch
Reviews.Content: Nice and beautiful hotel..Its located right in the center..Shopping street "sol" is just a few kms away...The swimming pool was just awsome and the view from the 10th floor looked really nice!! Breakfast was nice as well..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better pool”
Reviews.Author: anthonyandtania
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Emperador for 3 nights in September '09. It was a great stay in a beatiful hotel, very clean and the rooftop pool is a huge plus, the location could also not have been better bang in the middle of the grand via. One thing I would advise against (unless you have an unlimited budget) is eating or drinking in the hotel which we found very expensive with a small coke at 5.25(Euro) and breakfast at 20(euro) there are plenty of cheaper options a few doors down from the hotel. A great hotel which i'm happy to recommend to anyone visiting Madrid. Anthony and Tania David.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!! Beautiful pool area!”
Reviews.Author: musictravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I came here for 3 nights alone in June 2009 and everything was fantastic. The room was spacious with a massive bed and the bathroom was huge! It even had two showers, but i only used the bath one. Everything about it was clean and comfortable. A big tv screen was mounted on the wall in front of the bed but there weren't many english channels worth watching. The rooftop pool area was fabulous and JUST what you need in Madrid. The gym is small but has things you might like to use and is kept well. The Metro is right outside it and it is in the most brilliant location. The opera house/palace are just 5-10mins walk away and everything else isn't far at all. For couples this hotel would be really nice too. The staff were helpful too. The drinks and food are expensive, but so are all hotel menus! I read a couple of bad reviews before coming but the good ones outweighed them and it was worth it! You had to pay for wireless internet. Oh and also I had requested a room with a window out on Via Callas but they didn't give me one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Rooftop Pool”
Reviews.Author: claydo
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in August. After reading Trip Advisor reviews, I decided to go for this one based on location and rooftop pool. As with other reviews, I agree the rooms are dated, although they were large and comfortable.
