The bathroom could do with a decent shower, and we had no natural daylight in the room, due to the location. And now the positives, which in my opinion make this a great place to stay. The rooftop area was great. It was hot and sunny, there were plenty of sunbeds, and a great pool. Plenty of towels, and a good eating area, meant we spent some quality chill out time up there. The breakfast room, which looks recently renovated, was very nice, with a good selection of food, from pastries, eggs and bacon, cereals, and sparkling wine should you feel like one. The location of the hotel is great. Situated opposite Plaza De Espana on Line 10, it was very close to both Gran Via and Sol shopping areas. Some great Tapas bars a few minutes walk away. If we went to Madrid again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for seeing local sites”
Reviews.Author: strengthcoach
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry I didn't post this one earlier, because I can't go into as much detail now! My thoughts on the Emperador: We stayed for 7 nights over Thanksgving with my family - wife and two children under 7. We had a nice room, especially considering the discounted rate that we paid. We like to walk, whenever possible to the sites, so a central location is critical for us. As has been mentioned before, this hotel is on the gran via, and it was a great location to walk around Madrid from. I don't remember the food (we ate breakfast there once) being that great. After the first night, we just stocked up from the local conveinence stores to eat the next morning. We had a fridge, and it made the trip much more affordable. I would consider staying there again, if I had to go to Madrid. Some thoughts on Madrid: I was shocked that many of the Churches were simply closed for most of the day. Unlike several other Europea cities I've been to, most of the churches were closed except for Mass and very limited visitation times. Any trip must include the Prado (art museum) - it was one of the best - if not the best - I've ever been to. The Egyptian monument/temple (I forget the name) was free, and worth it as well. It's also worth seeing the royal palace. Very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “In my opinion not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinChristine
Reviews.Content: The redeemng factor of this hotel is the roof pool, great lounge beds and shade if you want it. The staff at the pool restaurant could not have been more accomodating. The reception staff were a different matter. Asking a question seemed to be an irritation to them, not very welcoming. Snacks were available on the roof, but they stopped serving at 5pm, the hotel does not have a restaurant. Also the bar staff were very stiff and not very nice, so we found a nearby bar to have a relaxing drink. The rooms were very basic and the prices were not. The hotel is in a very good location, close to reataurants and shopping. If I was to stay there again I would certainly upgrade to a club room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location on the Gran Via - close to Puerto del Sol”
Reviews.Author: MMM_Toronto
Reviews.Content: When my friend and I arrived for our 2 night stay, we were told our room was upgraded to a junior suite! While it was nice to have a big room, the beds - there were two twin beds. Not what I was expecting in a junior suite. The decor does not to be updated as it has the old-world charm...but needs to be brought into the new century. And unfortunately our toilet was not working when we got to the suite. One quick call to the front desk and they promptly sent maintenance to deal with the issue. The pool on the rooftop was very beautiful! It is a very big pool and the rooftop is quite spacious with great views of the Gran Via. The location can't be beat. Its right in the centre of town and was about an 8 min walk to Puerto del Sol. It was also very close to Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaBTorontoON
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location, right on the gran Via, close to Puerta del Sol. It was elegant and had very spacious rooms. We were bumped up to a Junior Suite at no extra cost. Staff was great and booked seats for Flamenco dancing and bull fight for us at our request. Roof top pool was fantastic, especially in 38 deg weather. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: funnywriter
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights in Madrid in the Emperador Hotel. The pluses: *The famous pool is excellent. The roof-top views are spectacular. And it's great to have a place to relax during the heat of the afternoon. *The location is excellent. A lively and gritty street with easy access to the Puerta Del Sol and the Plaza Mayor. The Metro is just across the street and no place in town is more than a short taxi ride away. *The people at the front desk are generally quite friendly and helpful. The minuses: *Some of the rooms are awful. When I arrived they put me in a roof about the size of my tiny kitchen back home. The view was of a wall. *The breakfast buffet is ridiculously expensive. It certainly is an acceptable city hotel and works just fine if you plan on being out and about in Madrid. But the hotel advertises itself as being a far more upscale establishment than it really is.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: spikeandrocky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights last week. I booked a triple standard room and it was quite large. Standard rooms come with single beds that cannot be pushed together so beware if you want a double bed. The carpet in the room was worn and had several large stains. The window hadn't been cleaned in awhile and had hand and nose prints from previous guests. The hotel bedspread was just plain gross. The bathrobes were worn and had large holes under the armpits. Why not just throw these away? Serious mold in the bathroom shower. The pool is large for a hotel in Spain and there were lots of lounge chairs but the patio is covered in astroturf which is faded and worn in many spots so unappealing. Several times when we were downstairs we heard other guests complaining about various things and the hotel staff seemed to be unresponsive. If I didn't have many activities planned in Madrid and was going to spend anytime in the room, I would have looked for another hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing ,”
Reviews.Author: SamCookie
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the hotel, the room was dark and just ok. We checked in and I have traveled for many years in the travel industry but the man that checked us in didn't explain anything to us. We had included breakfast with our plan and I had to call down to ask and all he really said was we didn't get it that day { I knew that it was already noon anyway }. Upon checking out the same person over charged us the room rate telling me I had a very good rate, I told him I had an ever better one and to recheck it. I asked about a bike trip and was directed to do a bus trip across the street, I didn't ask about that and we did a wonderful bike trip around town finding the information myself. It was overpriced even the rate I had. I would not stay there again. Location was good but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, pool is great, but....”
Reviews.Author: AOBMilan
Reviews.Content: it's crazy that it opens from 10am. I was there on business and would have loved to swim before going to the office. In the evening it closes at 9pm which is kind of early too...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool, great location but 13 Euros for a Gordons Gin!”
Reviews.Author: travelmacca
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 2 nights. Room was good, location was very central, loads of shops and bars etc within mins. The pool was brilliant, very quiet and relaxing, great views over madrid. The concierge was brilliant too. Only complaint is the bar prices, very very high. A shame when relaxing by the pool all day, but would reccomend the club sandwich!

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fidget1954
Reviews.Content: The location was good. The staff was excellent--very friendly and extremely knowledgable and helpful. Our breakfast was included. Had it not been included, the price would have been too high for the value. The downside was the heat and noise. Our room faced Gran Via, so the noise level was pretty bad. The a/c was working but they just don't allow the rooms to be very cool. Our teenagers had the same problem. The halls and common areas are much cooler. Beware--my husband was also pickpocketed on the subway. A Spanish woman told us this happens all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: DRG09
Reviews.Content: Located on the Gran Via with metro stations very close by - about 20 minutes and 2 euros from the airport, don't pay 45 euros for a taxi as the metro is very easy to use, clean and quick. We stayed in a standard king double which was spacious enough and newly refurbished with large LCD TV located in the middle of a mirrored wall. The bathroom was also newly refurbished. On a previous stay we had a non-refurbished room which was a lot bigger and of an equal standard. The pool is out of use during winter months so we didn't get to see it. Breakfast was poor but it was in the price we got, so we just had the cereals and coffee/tea - there are plenty of places to buy an inexpensive breakfast if required. We found the staff to be very efficient and helpful including the bar staff . Most things are walkable from this hotel, Sol and it's shops/bars/restaurants is about a 10 minute walk and the same for the Royal Palace. Within the city it's one euro for a single journey metro ticket and, as mentioned, it's very easy to get around on the metro with the ticket machines being in English. Overall, this is a good quality hotel which is reasonably priced for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, un-inspiring”
Reviews.Author: Pelikan
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay costing 105 euro for a standard room. Probably the worst hotel experience in the last 5 years or so. I declined the allocated room as it was swelteringly hot and NO a/c, (no matter what the website advertises). The 2nd room was smaller but at least had a/c. positives - central, clean negatives - room mis-described, charmless - view over a back alley - breakfast an extra 18 euros This was a good example of a website that over-promises, and a hotel management that under deliver. The much vaunted pool was closed - says it all. Well-situated in a central location, but there has to better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pierre48
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Emperador Hotel with a bunch of six mates. Our standard rooms were very spacious (unlike many other Spanish Hotels) and clean, albeit showing early signs of wear and tear. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. A very good hotel in a central location. We travelled in two taxis from the airport. One group of three were charged €25 (but about right with luggage) and the other group were charged €45 (the driver claimed it was due to supplements - a common ploy). For our return, the hotel organised an airport transfer for the six of us for a total of €45. It was prompt and supplement free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CultureVulture072
Reviews.Content: Spent a fantastic 5 nights at the Emperador Hotel and found the whole experience lived up to the pictures on the website. The room, although a standard room, was spacious and spotlessly clean and ,thanks to the air conditioning very cool. The bathroom was spacious and clean. Only complaint would be to provide an iron in the room as the laundry service is expensive. The rooftop pool and terrace is much bigger than it looks in the website and well maintained. A fantastic place to relax after a day sightseeing with a bottle of wine. The staff were all extremely helpful, recommending bars and places to eat as well as preventing a taxi driver over-charging us (our only bad experience of Madrid). Although the hotel is situated on the busy Gran Via we were not bothered with noise. The location enabled us to walk everywhere and experience Madrid. Excellent hotel for anyone who wants to stay in the centre but enjoy luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Pool is fab, hotel is average.”
Reviews.Author: Clare2007
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel with 2 redeeming factors which are both enough to recommend a stay here. 1 is the location, right on the Gran Via, as central as you can be. 2 is the fab rooftop pool and bar area. Rooms are a decent size and are quite nice. Not the cleanest though and the maid only makes the bed and gives you fresh towels, no cleaning as such and is in the room 15 mins max. Breakfasts are average, the hot food is pretty dire but there are plenty of cold items, bread, pastries, cheeses, ham etc to make for a decent breakfast - and there is sparkling wine too. Overall I would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool but with thieves!”
Reviews.Author: FamilleDiF
Reviews.Content: We booked the Emperador because my mom lives a block from there but couldn't accomodate our two families. So we obviously know the area extremely well, and being in August, we thought the kids would enjoy the rooftop pool in 40C weather (good thing we did, because there was a heat wave the day we arrived). The A/C actually works quite well. Reception was incredibly impersonal for a 4* hotel. We had three rooms on the same floor and they apparently upgraded us to club (which we appreciated due to the added security of an extra door, but we didn't used the lounge or anything like that) Breakfast was quite nice, especially for us Spanish born, all of our favourite things were available! Although again, the A/C was extremely strong (OK for American standards) The pool is, on paper and on site, extraordinary in size. Never seen a pool this large on a rooftop (close to 20m in length and almost 3m deep at one end), with a lifeguard (mandatory in Spain). The problem is that the whole deck/terrace surrounding the pool was chock-full, thankfully we only went late afternoon, when all the sun-crazed cancer seeking people started to leave. The bar rates are outrageously expensive (4EUR for a Coke), particularly knowing that most of the customers were residents. There were lockers in the changing rooms but my son and nephew did not think of locking their things. And sure enough, one watch (no huge cash value), and a t-shirt (definitely no cash value), were stolen. In itself, it was obviously our own fault, but I totally hated the pool employees telling me "oh this is the FIRST time this has ever happened" Come on!!! (we did see a group of young men who clearly were not staying at the hotel, probably the staff's buddies, who came and went). We were then told the hotel manager would come and talk to us, which he/she never ever did. So, even if legally they are not responsible for this, they obviously don't even care. Also, if you are allergic or have respiratory problems, this is NOT the pool to go to, as there is a very high level of pollution, and mixed with hot air, it can probably get you killed. I have no particular problems and couldn't stay very long because my throat was stinging and I started to have a dry cough. But not surprising as the hotel is on Gran Via (it's like Times Square in NY) and there are only 8 or 9 floors. I will definitely will not stay at this hotel ever again. It was not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh!”
Reviews.Author: hipfan14224
Reviews.Content: The pool is huge for a roof top one, the water refreshing, and the complimentary gin & tonics in the Emerador Club room were even more refreshing. Apparently during are stay, the Club rooms location was temporary, but on the day of departure, it was returned to it's usual place, which included a bar with beer tap, as well as the large screen tv and chairs/couches. The hotel room itself was nice sized, bathroom very nice sized. Close the windows, it was quiet, open them, and you could clearly hear the lively Gran Via below. This hotel was definitely one of the best on a 2 week trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Fiona133
Reviews.Content: For the price this has to be the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. We booked a club room for a romantic weekend, and were almost reassured by the fact it was so expensive (about €720 including taxes for 3 nights breakfast not included!) as we were after luxury and relaxation. Our room was horrible. It was much much smaller than the internet pictures suggested and it had twin beds even though we’d specifically booked a double. The only sign it was a club room was a large elaborate chandelier which dwarfed the room and looked ridiculous. We called reception, who were very off handed and told us there was nothing they could do as the hotel was fully booked, we weren’t happy so were told they ‘might be able to move us to a double if we rang again the next day’. We were pretty fed up so tried to cheer ourselves by going up to the roof top pool. The pool itself looked fine but it was extremely messy around the pool area, it wasn’t a relaxing space at all. I know it’s not the fault of the staff if customers move sun beds or leave litter, but I think it unacceptable in a hotel of this class that they don’t employ someone to have an occasional tidy up. Next we went to the club lounge. First - it’s not a ‘lounge’ at all, but a curtained off area of a breakfast room. Second – it made the pool area look pristine! The bar was covered with litter, half full glasses and decaying snacks. There’s no way I would have wanted to drink there. We’d seen enough. We went to the Room Mate Laura (where we’ve stayed before); they were fully booked but the friendly receptionist called their sister hotel Room Mate Mario who booked us in for the next two nights so we only had to spend one night at the Emperador. At Mario we were up graded from an executive room to a huge junior suite and our stay cost us less that half what the Emperodor would have cost! I’ve read reviews on here from people who’ve had a good stay at the Emperador so some of their rooms must be nice, but my advice would be not to risk it. At the prices they charge all their rooms should be nice, their public areas better cared for and receptionists more civil. The only plus points were - the location (though the Room Mate Mario was only 5 minutes away on a much quieter street behind the opera house), one out of three receptionists we spoke to was perfectly friendly and efficient (too little too late), our bathroom was perfectly adequate, our room had a tiny balcony with a good view. But these small plus points no way compensated for all the negative aspects of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “3 great days in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideTours
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. A true 4* with all amenities. We didn't stay in a Club Room as we were weren't planning on being in the hotel that much and wanted to eat / drink in Madrid not in the hotel so didn't think we would get the value. Our rooms (2 doubles) were small but clean and the bathrooms were relatively new with fresh towels daily. The view was non-existent but we didn't mind as we didn't spend any time looking out of the window!!! The rooftop pool was superb, especially after a days sightseeing and the breakfast was also plentiful. The hotel itself is well appointed and we only met helpful staff - they rang restaurants for us and made reservations and also helped with a few directions. The bar is expensive but we only had one drink there. Santo Domingo metro station is right outside and all the main sights, except possibly Retiro Park, are in walking distance. We booked via HotelClub.net and got a double room and breakfast for £126 per night - well worth it if only for its location and the pool. Definitely recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big mistake”
Reviews.Author: harholm
Reviews.Content: I booked the room in april / may, cause I like the location and thought the rooms looks okay and it was a plus with the roof garden/pool. Arrived late, the room was ready, but the service at the desk was - sorry my "french" so damm snobby, that I was about to turn around and walk out again. But since I was not alone and we where tired after a long day with traveling, we checked in. The room...was a run down room, nothing like the ones the "claim" to have on the net (photos). Okay, so I did not book the fancy suite, just a normal twin bed room, but.... it was run down and ready for renovation. The service, did impove on the day shift, the where kind and abel to help. The pool service, was great - nice "kids" working there and all in all, a nice place to spend a few hours after a long day of sightseeing. Only minus - the pool is freezing. I'm somewhat close to a polar bear, but I nearly had a heart attack jumping in. You have to swim to keep warm or get out. The location is great. Would I recomend the hotel? No ! I would go for a cheaper one or pay for a better suite - but never that hotel again. We had arranged for a "limo drive through" town one night, and the service staff, could hardly keep there noses from the windowns, as the stod there watching and drowing and talking about "who it might be for". Diskret? No, never.... Best...was when we went out to the limo - the nose in the sky receptionist (from the night before), almost pushes us away when he was trying to get in the hotel door, after talking with the driver...guess he was about to look "for the secret famous person" who lived in the hotel - while it "just was us" - the joke was on him.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Position”
Reviews.Author: cdavies757
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Emperador Hotel for 3 nights on the 22nd August. This was my fifth trip to Madrid in 5 years and the hotel was simply the best I've stayed in based on location and the roof top pool. The bedrooms were simple but perfectly clean and adequate but the most engaging feature of the Emperador is the roof top bar and pool. There are not many City Centre Hotels in Europe that have this facility. In a hot climate like Madrid its perfect to sit by the pool with a cool drink after a day sightseeing. The location is on the Gran Via and a Metro Station is 100 meters away. An excellent choice ............

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jade-Stamford
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Emperador in Madrid. This is a great hotel if you wish to combine sightseeing with relaxation as the location is great and the rooftop pool and sun terrace provide a welcome treat after busy days visiting nearby attractions and bargain hunting in the surrounding shops. The hotel is ideally located for the main city sites - less than 10 minutes walk to the Royal Palace, the Cathedral and the Plaza Mayor (great for food and drink day and night without traffic!). It is a little further on foot to other attractions such as the Prado Museum of art and the beautiful boating lake in the Parque del Retiro. The hotel is also just a short journey by Metro tube to the Zoo and nearby theme park - Parque de Attractiones. We loved Madrid and will definitely stay at this hotel again because of its location and the rooftop pool. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the breakfast sufficient. Prices of drinks in the bar were high and even more expensive on the rooftop - 42 euros for a bottle of brut Cava (our favourite Spanish tipple) 22 euros for 2 white rum and cokes, €16 for a litre of beer and €4,50 for a small coffee. There is a wide choice of places to eat and drink near the hotel, some charging almost as much so it's preferable to shop around if you're on a modest budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cantthink
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the emperador for three nights in a triple room and although I would agree the room was not 4 star but it was lovely. It was clean and spacious enough. The linen and towels etc were changed daily it was only the wall paper that was a little worn. The hotel was very quiet even though it was fully booked. The rooftop bar and pool is worth the stay alone. The pool is 10 floors up and offers a magnificent view of Madrid. Also be prepared as the pool is bracing to say the least but welcome as it was 40 degrees plus. There are lots of sunbeds as long as you're there before 2. The bar is however expensive (London prices) The hotel itself is fab, really clean and shared areas very 4 stars. The staff were friendly enough and efficient. I really can't fault the place. We didn't have any meals in the hotel but out of the door and left are Italian restaurants and right there is VIPS which serves a good value breakfast. I would also recomend Vitamins for lunch and fruit drinks. The tour bus stops just over the road and is great, it doesn't start till 9.30 but runs to midnight, good as it takes you to most major places. Overall a great hotel and very central with close amenaties.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room but worth it for the pool”
Reviews.Author: KfromBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and had a pleasant experience. The room was clean but small and I wouldn't consider it 4* standard. Had a view of a brick wall and as the room was joined to another we could hear voices/TV through the wooden door. Toiletries provided weren't great (would have liked some conditioner!) there is a hairdryer. There is a safe.The room was cleaned each day. However the location was excellent and the swmming pool area was very nice with good views- towels provided. I found the staff helpful. The breakfast was good with a large selection. It cost 22 euro for taxi ride to airport.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cuatemochas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in this hotel a few weeks ago. We booked the 922 room, a club romm with one queen size bed and a balcony. We went to the club bar to drink some beverages free of charge. The bar tender was a very funny a kind guy. On the roof there is a beautiful swimming pool, not large but very clean. People in the frot desk was very kind and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelguyandgirl26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Emperador hotel for 4 nights in July, and thought it was quite nice. What we liked the most about the hotel was its location.. its great especially for tourists! All the major sightseeing places (the plazas, royal palace, etc) are located within walking distance of the hotel. There is also a tourist information center close by. Metro station right outside the hotel, and since the hotel is located right on Gran Via, there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. (we recommend Pizza Marzano right down the road from the hotel) The people at the front desk are not very friendly (except for Aurora.. she is very helpful).. the room was a little small but still clean and comfortable. Bathroom very clean. Noises in the night didn't wake us up, but we weren't facing the main road anyway. Breakfast was included in our package and was ok, no complaints but nothing fantastic either. We were initially a little worried about going out in the night since we heard its not so safe.. but we were out till 1030 without any problem.. beyond that not so sure since we didn't risk it! Overall a nice hotel, clean, centrally located and convenient. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: zzcorber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed last week in Madrid, and we chosen Emperador Hotel to stay 3 fab u lous nights! This hotel is located in Madrid Centre, with Metro Santo Domingo just in front of the building. We booked a room in Club Emperador because we had read some post in internet where recommended upgrade to have a better room and views to Gran Via and we thought it was a good decission because our room was big, comfortable, good size and had extra services like coffee & tea maker. The decoration of the hotel and rooms is very very classic, event it is totally refurbished. During our check-in a young man was helpfull and nice, and informed us about Breakfast, Swimmingpool and Club Emperador Lounge. He was very friendly during our stay, and he gave us a Madrid map with usefull information and reccomendations. During every morning, we visited Almudena Cathedral and Royal Palace, Prado Museum, Faunia and the big store "El Corte Ingles" in Preciados street for shopping. We lunched in the Restaurants typical of the Plaza Mayor or other nice streets in the centre, with Spanish food. During afternoons, we enjoyed Madrid sun in the swimming-pool of the hotel, absolutely wonderfull but only one dissappointment: the drinks and food in the bar too expensive... But we had drinks and snack included in Club Emperador so when we wished have a drink, we went to Club Emperador Lounge. The breakfast was good, in a nice room with natural daylight and the staff was correct. We recommend this hotel to visit Madrid because is comfortable, good location and have Swimming-pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but accomodation not worth the rates”
Reviews.Author: jmpadams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on 17th June and whilst it was a nice looking hotel and a good location the rooms were small and basic. There are other hotels in the area which are much cheaper . A good point about the hotel is its roof top pool which is pretty but be warned it is freezing! Also if you are on a budget dont consider buying drinks or food here as they are very expensive. All in all the hotel staff are friendly however some will go out of their way more than others to make your stay worthwhile. We have been to various places in Spain, including Barcelona however we wouldnt rate Madrid as one our favourite destinations and dont think we will be visiting again. A good point was the metro network and you can get to and from the airport quite quickly There are some nice eating areas around the hotel but watch out for some dodgy areas around the Gran Via with ladies of the night virtually every few yards with pimps near by and rip off bars. Another point to remember is brush up on your Spanish as most bars owners do not go out of the way to understand what you are saying and quite rightly so!. Lucky for us my wife learned some simple Spanish before we left England!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Emperador--Madrid's Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MLtravels
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Emperador during my stay in Madrid in May 2008. This classic beauty is in the heart of Madrid located on the Gran Via. Its traditional and elegant decor takes you back to the style of Old Europe. I choose the Club Emperador Room, Jr. Suite. I highly recommend choosing the Club Emperador type of accomodation as it included entrance into a private room that offered a complimentary bar of snacks, beverages and alcohol. Also, breakfast was included which was a large and delicious buffet. There is a beautiful lobby with seating and a bar area. There is a large roof-top pool with a view of the city and especially the Royal Palace. This area is beautifully maintained and a bar is located at poolside as well. It was a treat to take a moment to sit in this area taking in Madrid from high above the city. With ease, I was able to walk the city from the Hotel Emperador. The Madrid Vison Tourist Bus was on the corner right outside the hotel. Many cafe's were near the hotel and a Starbuck's is across the street. I found the front desk personnel to be very friendly, helpful and they spoke english. The room was large with windows that opened onto the Gran Via. The furnishings were new and the room was very clean. The bathroom lovely with a large tub and bathrobes. I was happy to not hear any hall noise or noise from the room next door. A very quiet property. I will surely return to the Hotel Emperador and hightly recommend this property for any traveler who likes their space to be traditional elegance. Once you take in the beauty and cleanliness of Madrid, it will surely be a favorite European destination. The architecture of each building is beautiful...a very artistic city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with six friends last month for 3 nights to celebrate my birthday. We booked two 'triple' rooms. We booked via the hotel website and chose to go with 'standard' rooms including breakfast. Having read other reviews, I can't say I was expecting our rooms to be up to much, so what a surprise we all had when on our arrival we found we had been put into two of the "Club Emperador" suites. One of which was the "Grand Via" suite on the 9th floor. Both rooms were lovely. We had use of the "club" and enjoyed our free gin and tonics, schnapps and beer! I must say though, that we stumbled across the "club" quite by mistake, so if you are staying in the "Club Emperador" part of the hotel make sure you locate it early on into your stay. The rooftop pool was gorgeous but unfortunately it was far too cold to go swimming so we just enjoyed the fabulous view of Madrid. All in all, we found this hotel a great place to stay. It was a very central location, close to shops, cafes and restaurants. All six of us would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A four stars hotel with zero star service”
Reviews.Author: EspenHilde
Reviews.Content: I informed the hotel when I booked and also in a reminder mail before we went, that the stay was as celebrating for my husbands 50th birthday. It’s quite common that hotels do their best to make some surprise like a bottle of wine on the room on such days. On this hotel however, nothing was done for him! They did not treat their customers as guests at all. And everything was done to get paid for. After travelling a lot both in Spain and other countries, I can hardly remember a hotel where you have to pay for using the Internet (the last years). I don’t mean wireless on the room, but at a PC in the common area. In our package entrance to a club with free snacks and drinks was included. We were guided by the staff about where the breakfast was and so on, but not a word about the club. We had to find it ourselves. This was obviously a policy to avoid guests going there. We talked to some other guests and they had the same impression The 8th of May, when I thought they would give some extra service, the club was even closed, for some arrangement. It means we paid for a service that they were not able to give us. And all they did to make up for it was, after we asked for it, one drink in the lobby bar. And they were so afraid of extra costs, that we were not allowed to drink something else than was in the club – What a guest treatment!!! - The day after we went to the club, and then we had to ask for filling up the gin and waiting for that! And after that we had to do the same for the tonic water. We informed the staff during the stay that we were disappointed, but they did not care. Afterwards we wrote them a mail, and they didn’t response to it! A hotel to stay away from!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Superb
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Emperador. Very comfortable room. Breakfast was superb - loads of fresh fruit and everything else one could want. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, tiny room, good bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: We've stayed on Gran Via before and I have to say I was expecting a noisy hotel with safety issues after reading some of the reviews here previously. What we found was a clean hotel with surprisingly quiet rooms with friendly staff. Check in was quick and easy, our room was on the 4th floor, kind of in the middle of the building as we faced a wall and it was clean but very compact & bijou! Facing the wall actually worked in our favour to be honest because the "air conditioning" seemed to be set to heat no matter how low it was on, so we were forced to have the window open, but because we weren't on the street there was no noise whatsoever! The bathroom was pleasantly surprising in terms of being a reasonable size with what seemed to be fairly new fittings. I wouldn't personally class this hotel as a 4 star, but I know it's based on ameneities, and in theory, the Emperador has a lot. What we were after was a good location and you don't get much better than being towards the top end of Gran Via. As long as you don't plan on spending a lot of time in the room (why would you in Madrid?!), I would recommend this place for all sorts of people as a perfect base with pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: DublinJohn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of my friends.It is in a great and safe location.The hotel staff were very good to us and all that could be done to make our stay more enjoyable was done.I got a club room and it was very big and clean,the other rooms are smaller but cheaper. Overall a fab place to stay....

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wherever the cheap fares take me
Reviews.Title: “Noisest hotel stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: antonius66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days with some friends in Feb 2008. First the positives: 1) The location of this hotel is GREAT. It is right next to a Metro station, right on the Gran Via and easy to get to most anything from the hotel. 2) The price was good for the location and quality of hotel. 3) The room itself is pretty nice...fairly large, nice bathroom, beds etc. Now the negative... The walls in this hotel are like wet toilet paper. We heard EVERYTHING going on on the entire floor. The maids were super loud every morning and I could hear them yelling outside my door every morning starting promptly at 0730 hours. After complaining, I didn't hear them yelling, I just heard them blaring over their walkie talkies. Every time a door slammed (which was often) I could hear it rattle my room. Basically, I was up every morning at 8 am because I didn't have a choice. They apparently were also doing some type of construction, as I heard drilling and hammering in adjacent rooms alllllllll day, every day. There was basically no sleeping in, and no quiet peace in the room during the day. Now, my mother has also stayed in this hotel before and says it was very quiet, so I apparently was very very unlucky. All in all, despite the major sound issues, I would give it one more run, as the price and quality of the room/location were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a mere 10m from the metro station and that's no exaggeration at all. It's also on a very busy, high energy street which is bang in the city centre so it's very convenient. There are a pair of windows to keep the noise down to nothing and the aircon works well so the rooms are comfortable. They're also reasonably sized and well fitted. The bathrooms are exceptional. The staff are very helpful and all have enough enough English to help out. There was a minor problem when we were given the wrong type of room - twins aren't very good for a romantic getaway! - but it was sorted instantly. The pool on the roof is great. It was a little cold when we were there but it was October so that's to be expected. If you want a sun lounger that is sheltered from the wind, you'll have to be up early. We didn't eat there so can't comment on that but overall the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ...”
Reviews.Author: RiannaWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Great location but had the potential to be so much better! A bit shabby chic. Breakfast not included, no kettle in room and internet in room costs 7 euros for an hour! Only English TV channels are CNN and SKY news. Was okay but with a litlle extra could be great.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: LiamGeraldine
Reviews.Content: had a fantastic time at this hotel, great location right on the Gran Via, surrounded by many bars and restaurants and within walking distance of all the major attractions, hotel staff really helpful recommended places to check out and took care of our luggage as we had a late departure time, loved the buffet breakfast, great choice, fruit ,cold meats,cheeses, eggs,bacon,saugages,pasteries,would definitely go back to this hotel but before end of September as the pool was closed when we were there and it looked absolutely beautiful, only downside was, we were allocated a room that had no view and looked on to the hotel wall which made the room very dark. Madrid is a beautiful vibrant city can't wait to go back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - I loved”
Reviews.Author: Laurapintas
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel.Excellent room with 1 double bed and 1 single bed.Good and big bathroom.The breakfast is great.Metro is in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the roof !!!”
Reviews.Author: Tattiehowk
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms here and one being a triple beddded room. All were clean and comfortable. The hotel was advertised with a swimming pool but I expected a small tub. It was however a fairly large pool where you could actually do a bit of swimming . Around the pool were sun loungers or you could sit at tables. Then you can go to the bar at the pool entrance and order whatever you require. The sun loungers were being put to good use when I was there. It is certainly a good way to relax after a day of sightseeing.The only trouble is that you may want to lie there and forget the Prado visit. The changing rooms and toilets were immaculate Breakfast was the usual scrambled eggs to cheese and meats. The staff were pleasant and when needed , helpful Situated down the Gran Via , it is in a fine spot for all tourist sights Thanks to a previous reviewer who said the hotel was right o/s Metro Santo Domingo.Otherwise it is a five minute treck from Calleo or 10 minutes from Gran Via

Reviews.Title: “Disspointed by dishonest service.”
Reviews.Author: addar
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 Club Rooms via our travel agent and paid good money for them. Upon checking-in, they gave us 3 rooms on the same floor as per requested, BUT without informing us, gave us only 1 club room! The non-club rooms were old, dirty, run-down, noisy and lack amenties. I called the reception and ask for a change of rooms and they said impossible as the hotel is fully booked!!! I went to the reception desk to demand for the change, with the reservation slip that stated clearly that the booking was for CLUB rooms. The same staff who checked us in was not apologetic at all, and told me that if we change the rooms, then they wouldn't be on the same floor. I said ok. He upgraded one of the rooms to a junior suite on another floor, but as the hotel is fully booked, he can't change the other room till the next day. What disappointing service was that... despite being in a good location. Well, there are very many other hotels in the vincinty which guests can choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JodyZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite with an adjacent club room for our two kids. The Junior Suite is incredibly spacious with sweeping views of the Gran Via. Ideally located with a rooftop pool (a must in August) and walking distance to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, The Palace and a quick taxi ride to the museums. Our rooms were ready at 10 am when we arrived, exhausted from an overnight train from Paris and the staff was incredibly accommodating. The club was a great place to regroup and have a refreshing cold drink after a day of touring. This was a grand hotel in the old tradition, old but well maintained and spacious by any standard.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Emperador -- A great choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: door60
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We stayed in a Club Room, as we read those were slightly better than a regular room. The room was spacious (by European Standards). There were 3 of us -- my husband, my 10 year old son, and myself. The bathroom was beautiful. We were close to everything -- including a metro station. The pool was really beautiful, but we did not take advantage of it. We also did not take advantage of the buffet breakfast, but if we would go back to Madrid again, we would take the buffet breakfast. Eating at the hotel saves a lot of time wandering around deciding where you're going to eat. I definately recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs”
Reviews.Author: Joycee62
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights and we were pleased with the hotel. Arrived from US after flying all night and rooms were ready early, as we had requested. Our request for quiet side of hotel and 2 rooms adjacent was honored too. Room was a nice size, clean and had a modern bathroom. There was not much drawer space for unpacking. The front desk staff was helpful, although one receptionist kept giving me incorrect information, so be careful. Rooftop pool was beautiful and a great place to relax after a long day of sightseeing. It stays light out until 9pm so we took our evening "siesta" there before dinner. Prices for drinks VERY expensive, a coke was $5Euro. Location was great, walking distance to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor and Plaza Espana. Plaza Domingo Metro Station right outside the door. Gran Via is very touristy and a bit dirty though. Breakfast was suitable, meats, cheeses, eggs and fruit. I would recommend staying here if you want a larger hotel with many ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaNoreenAnn
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my Friend and her 2 Grils. Got two twin rooms, they were spacious, mini-bar, hair dryer in the room,they have a safe but you must get a key off reception to activate the safe, they do not have a tea & coffee in the room at all. Look for a non-smoking room. The roof top pool was lovely, water cold but once you are in the pool it is good and there is plenty of sun seating area for those you wish not to swim. The drink and food is very dear in the pool area alright. Check to see if the pool is opened before you booked has it is closed some of the months. The breakfast is not your Irish Breakfast at all, cold meats, cheese, yougurts, fruit, etc. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would recommand this hotel to stay in. It is central to the shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Staff rude”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week, and was not impressed by the staff at all, which was a shame. The first morning we went for breakfast reaching the door, well before breakfast was meant to finish. They refused to let us in and when we complianed to the manager and he accused us of lying, after refusing to budge he finally went downstairs and asked the staff to let us in. Our room was an interconnecting room, however after two days of being there we noticed someone open the interconnecting door. The staff had not locked this door, prior to us staying there. I noticed my money had been stolen, most likely from someone entering the interconnecting door. I alerted the staff and was again told i was lying and then saying that it was my family who must have stolen the money. They refused to help or even write a letter stating i had informed them so that I could claim on my insurance. The staff were just rude, in particular the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location!”
Reviews.Author: HellieCopter
Reviews.Content: Our trip was somewhat overshadowed by an extremely difficult journey and lost baggage, but I will try not to let that affect my review of the hotel!! We were a group of 7 girls and stayed at the Emperador this weekend on a hen party (a sophisticated, relaxing one!). We had two twin rooms and a triple. Our 3rd floor rooms were very varied - one large with a lovely view (321), one smaller also with a good view of the gran via (327), and one small with a view of the opposite wall (320) but all rooms were clean, tastefully decorated and even the small room was a comfortable size. Plenty of wardrobe space and general storage, a tv, a radio/cd player, good size bathroom (with good selection of toiletries). The shower is okay. Good water pressure and temperature, but quite a small shower head with thin water jets, which was a bit disappointing. Housekeeping was very good. The air conditioning was excellent. Very efficient - meaning we didn't need to leave it whilst we were out (which is a pet hate of mine - excess energy consumption and all that!) We paid a supplement for the Club Emperador rooms, which got us more spacious rooms (although we didn't see the other rooms) and a seperate lounge/breakfast room. There was a larger selection of breakfast foods (which was excellent in both the standard dining room and the club room). The lounge also provided free drinks during certain hours (alcoholic and soft drinks) and although not a wide selection, was great for the group congregating before going out for dinner. The rooftop pool area is lovely. Great views. The pool is a good size so you can have a proper swim, but be warned, it's very chilly!!! It's breezy up there, but for us that provided a welcome cooling from the hot sun!There are plenty of loungers and towels are provided up there. It was busy on the weekend but much quieter on the Monday. The pool bar is also good and does lounger service at certain times. It's quite pricey, but that's to be expected in a hotel (6 euros for soft drinks). There's a good changing area, which is handy if you want to relax after checkout and shower/change. The pool itself is open to the public at some times. There are 3 lifts...small but relatively quick. Two are facing the main lobby, a 3rd is just round the side to the left, which is less used and arrives much faster! This doesn't go up to the pool though. The staff were attentive and helpful. They helped us a lot by making calls for us in Spanish, to check our lost luggage. Their English was also very good. The concierges were very helpful. We did encounter quite a few problems at check-out, which delayed us by an hour! We were charged different rates from those we'd booked at, had extra breakfasts charged but the person who did the booking had printed all our info out so we were ok eventually! I'd just advise checking your printed invoice carefully before paying. Overall, a very nice hotel and I'd definitely stay there again and recommend it to people. If you hunt around on the internet for good rates, it's pretty reasonably priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location if a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: colinrchorley
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed at the Emperador Hotel Madrid for a short 2 night weekend break to watch Real Madrid and found the hotel to be fine for what we needed but maybe just a few niggles to be called exceptional. Getting to the hotel is very simple. From Barajas Terminal 4 you can get the Metro straight into the city for next to nothing and is relatively quick. I went to Madrid last year and had to get a bus to the other terminals but they have now extended the line to Terminal 4 saving lots of time. The Metro station Santo Domingo is more ort less right outside the hotel although we found it easier to use Callao and walk as Line 2 seemed very quiet compared to Line 5. From the outside it looks very impressive looking directly out on to the Grand Via with a large revolving door to enter through. Checking in was quick and simple and cannot fault the service, I requested the football tickets to be delievered to the hotel before my arrival and indeed the hotel had put them aside for me (much to my relief as they had cost a small fortune and the game was only 2 hours away at the time). 2 small lifts in the main lobby were available although believe there were more lifts round the side but can be a problm at check out time when the lift is taken up completely but one family with luggage and is not that quick either. We had booked a triple room and were up on the 6th floor. Initial impressions were good, a small hallway took us into the room, triple was indeed 3 single beds which is what was hoped for although the room was actually a twin room with a temporary bed rolled in (unfortunately for me I got that one), in saying that though the bed was quite comfy and slept soundly on it. The room had plenty of space, somewhere to hang shirts but maybe could have done with a few more hangers (something I'm sure you can request from reception), a safe was available but needed a key to unlock from the inside so not sure if this was a cost option or not so did not use it, the air conditioning was excellent and cooled the room down very quickly, the bathroom had a bath or shower and was perfectly adequate even for 3 needing to share but the toilet was a little awkward to get on properly. We had a view to the side of the hotel so were just slightly off the main road but the noise could still be heard even on the 6th floor (mainly sirens rather than the traffic itself though) but did keep one of us up most of the night. The location though for getting round Madrid is excellent as its right in the middle of the city and pretty much everything is accessible on foot but the Metro is quick and effecient too. Breakfast was included in the price and was a very large selection of cereals, cold meats, pastries, bread rolls, cheese, fruit and hot breakfasts in the form of bacon, sausages and scrambled eggs. It can get quite busy so be prepared to wait in line before someone takes a room number and sits you down, especially if you are a large group. The lobby area is very relaxing for having a quick drink before going out if a tad expensive and we also sampled the rooftop terrace complete with swimming pool but it was a little cold at the time to go in so stuck with a light lunch instead which was very nice but if again a little expensive. All in all I suppose this would be the only real problem wth the hotel, we paid a total of £314 (originally £330 through Airmiles but got the reduction) for the room for 2 nights which is fine when split between 3 but may be a bit slightly overpriced for the room itself. Other than that I enjoyed the stay and would be happy to recommend to anyone else staying in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: mcdd
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two night weekend break in the emperador hotel. It was a girlie weekend and I must say the hotel lived up to our standards. Its in a good location walking distance really to the puerto del sol and most of the nightlife. The rooftop pool was a big plus with this hotel as the fri we arrived was extremely hot and it was really nice to just lie by the pool and chill out for a couple of hours, however i did find drinks quite expensive here. My only regret was that i did not book another night in this city we had such a great time and hope to go back soon. For any girls looking to do shopping here its fantastic found the best bag shops at unbelievable prices and for nightlife we went to Dubliners which wasnt your typical irish pub plenty of other nationalities drank here also. We just found it had a great atmosphere here. The hotel was comfortable, clean had a lovely bathroom and i would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Woo4uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location on Gran Via a short walk from Puerto del Sol, Plaza Mayor and the bustling nighttime area La Latina. From that perspective it is an excellent choice for a city break. The public areas are smart and I understand that some of the rooms are very nice. (My travelling companion had stayed at the hotel before). Our room was a very small double even by city hotel standards. Despite a request for a high floor we were on the second floor with a stunning view of a dark alleyway. The aircon was blowing hot air and the shower was either too hot or too cold. The hotel lacked the usual array of toiletries in the bathroom that one would expect. The minibar seemed to be broken and there were no clear instructions for the room safe. A major selling point for this hotel apart from its location is the rooftop pool and bar. This is an excellent spot to wind down after a day's sightseeing and although it was still too cold to swim when we were there, it will come into its own for visitors later in the year. Lastly the breakfast was pathetic. The coffee was rotten coming from a machine. The selection of fruit and cold cuts looked tired and unappealing. At five past the breakfast endtime the staff started clearing up and switching off the machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stannn
Reviews.Content: In a great location on the Grand Via this hotel offers a standard of luxury greater than its 4 stars might imply. Look around for a deal when booking, as its possible to get breakfast included in the rates. The executive upgrade is worth paying extra for - providing access to a comfortable and complimentary lounge/ bar. If staying in a room overlooking the street, insist on one with sound-proofing as the street is very noisy all night long. Did not sleep the first night due to the noise, but promptly changed to a higher floor the next morning The hotel provides old-school, if a little dated, glamour - brass rails and chandillers - and the rooms are huge. Bathrooms are full-on marble with flufy bathrobes. I would be more likely to book this for my parents rather than for myself going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: obi7
Reviews.Content: Very good located in central Madrid, nicely furnished rooms, good service. It is worth booking Club Emperador (extra large room, nice view on the city, extended breakfast and longe for Club guests). Be careful by booking, because some of the rooms overlook on a wall and are less friendly. If you ask for a nice room the hotel is recommended to stay there. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the cofee”
Reviews.Author: trellis2
Reviews.Content: A good but not great 4 night stay. The hotel is on the Gran Via - main road through City Centre, well-located for theatres, old town restaurants and bars, Palazzo Real, etc, with a Metro station right outside front door. Well-furnished room - not huge but perfectly comfortable and quiet. All service efficient if not all that friendly. Ground floor piano bar comfortable for cocktails etc. The only real drawback was breakfast. A rather limited buffet, by major European City standards, with the most disgusting coffee from a machine. This made the Starbucks on the opposite side of the Gran Via popular with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cariadbri
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in January for a shopping weekend. Arrived Saturday evening, Madrid centre closed Sunday but a shopping mall on the outskirts of town open. Booked Club Emperada rooms after seeing notices. Room fine, bed a bit hard. Staff all pleasant and very helpful. Drinks in the bar a bit pricey, but we did get lots of nibbles with the drinks. Found a nice bar around the corner where drinks half the price. Pool closed during winter and it was very cold but enjoyed weekend all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Let Down”
Reviews.Author: ACat1
Reviews.Content: I booked the Emperador for my pre-wedding get away with 5 girlfriends. I was hugely disappointed. The rooms were old, dark drab and very dated (not in a good way) with views of walls and outside pipes. The feeling of disappointment when I walked into the first room/shoebox I was allocated was crushing - this was supposed to be a 4* hotel - and I had chosen it for everyone! I was grudgingly given another room to look at, which although bigger was equally dark and uninspiring and was on another floor away from our other friends. Their rooms were not much better and one had big problems with the shower. Worse than that was the service - extremely slow, un customer friendly and even rude. This especially seemed to appy up in the pool bar where, apart from one young waiter who was new and lovely, we felt completely invisible. The times for serving food seemed to be minimal, even though it was available elsewhere in the hotel and even when we got there specifically before their 'deadline' we were still told we couldn't have anything. The menu was limited and basically prepared. The pool area saved the stay it was the only good thing. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: HAU635
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for a shopping weekend with my 8 girl friends. This was on my recommendation having visited the previous year with my partner and enjoyed a very comfortable, large room. We were allocated twin rooms on the third floor. The rooms were in great need of refurbishment (peeling wallpaper), dark, musty and we even had a hole in the ceiling of one room. No mirror in the bedroom and an aged chocolate brown bathroom suite. We did ask if we could be relocated or upgrade but were told the hotel was full, which was clearly untrue. Two of our group had booked directly with the hotel and paid an additional 20 Euros to upgrade to Club Emperador. The standard of their accomodation was far superior and I would recommend visitors explore this option. They had access to a private lounge with complementary bar and breakfasted seperately. The only saving grace is that the hotel is in a superb location and the roof top pool and terrace are brilliant. Generally the staff were not friendly and service at breakfast and in the bar area was poor. Madrid is a lovely city and I will certainly return but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Emperador”
Reviews.Author: Aussiguys
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay in the Emperador in early June. Our room was large with a moderately comfortable bed (two singles pushed together) Clean and quiet as it faced inward and was thus a little dim. A large bathroom, very clean with a full sized tub and good water pressure, once you were able to get hot water. At any time of day it seemed to take forever to get the water to run hot, though once there it never ran out. A good location, within easy walk of the Palace and its gardens as well as the Prado, 15 min walk up the Gran Via. Friendly and knowledgable staff who spoke English. The breakfast buffet was OK, plentiful with some good Spanish cured Ham and a bizarre coffee machine which gave a reasonable cup of espresso once it was mastered. A warning to those travelling with children, it is easy to stumble on previews of porno movies while channel surfing the TV, you can have this service disabled by calling reception. The pool and rooftop bar are above average.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and pool for hot Madrid”
Reviews.Author: HoulaLoula
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Emperador for 4 nights 6/7 - 10/7 on a hen weekend. Good central hotel with the much needed pool for the Madrid summer heat. Clean pool and sunbathing area as well as the oiutside bar and snack area. Slow service for drinks and lunch and Spanish people tended to get served first but hey this is Spain and what's the rush! Room was fairly small but clean and the air conditioning worked a treat. TIP:- get 2 room keys and leave one in the room so air con is on all day and take the other with you for access. Others in our group had great rooms TIP:- see if you can get a Club Emperador room. Overlooking Gran Via so can be slightly noisier but worth it for the size of the room as well as the tea making facilities etc. You could have got 3 of our room in one Club room! Breakfast was good with OJ, coffee etc as well as pastries, cereals, fruit, meats, Enough for a good breakfast. Whilst you're in Madrid walk to Sol and go to Bar Taurina. Great Tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: oncdoc
Reviews.Content: This is a good (not great) hotel in a very good location. For those who want to explore Madrid without spending a fortune this is a good option. The pool is particularly appealing to those travelling with kids and is nicely situated on the hotel roof. The Club Floor was pleasant -- thought the coffee was...(well nevermind, I'm supossed to keep my language clean). Overall impression of the Service was quite favorable & for a largish hotel I think they've done quite a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Love it, Didn't Hate It”
Reviews.Author: JessSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Emperador for 4 days, and we were not impressed. Overall, it is clean and comfortable; however, don't expect anything special. We had requested a single bed when we made the reservation but were given a room with a tiny twin bed. They offered to switch us to a room with a larger bed the next day (which we did). The staff, in general, speak English well and are friendly and helpful. However, don't expect immediate service. I would have to call at least 3 times if I needed something before it would actually happen. Also, I was really disappointed that they did not have irons available (especially when paying $200/night). They encouraged use of their "pressing service" which cost about 10 euros per piece of clothing! Ha! My boyfriend and I must have had a 'standard' room (on the 2nd floor) because it sounds nothing like what I have read from other reviewers - also, our mini bar was NOT free! As for breakfast, it was very average. Also, beware: make sure that breakfast is included in your room fee; otherwise, they will charge you 18 euro! It is DEFINITELY not worth 18 euro. I arrived in Madrid one week before my boyfriend and stayed at the Melia Madrid Princesa (right down the street a few blocks) and it was so much better and about the same price. They had a fantastic breakfast (everything you could imagine), great service, better rooms, and an iron available upon request! The hotel is definitely in a prime location and convenient to most tourist attractions. Also, the pool is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasubar
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Emperador, the first having been back in 1994. We liked it then but loved it this time. The Gran Via is a bustling city street, and our room directly overlooked it. Fortunately, the hotel has double windows which were very effective at blocking out any noise. I'm a very light sleeper and never heard a thing. The Emperador is in a perfect location to enjoy the city either on foot or via the cheap (1 Euro), efficient Metro. There's a Metro stop literally right in front of the hotel. The only time we took taxis was to and from the airport, and even that trip could have been done on the subway. The decor of the rooms themselves appears to be dated, but I think this is just the style and not that it's actually old. The mattress is very firm - which is my preference. I think this was the most comfortable bed I've slept on in a long time. Rooms have a mini-bar and a safe (free to use, but you do have to get a key from the front desk). We had upgraded to the "bed and breakfast" package. Turned out to be a great bargain. Not only was the breakfast better than what was in the main dining room (and with free cava as well) but we also had access to a "club room" that opened at noon each day with unlimited beer on tap, light snacks, soft drinks, bottled water and a handful of flavored liqueurs. We found that between the free breakfast and the snacks, we generally did not need to buy lunch anywhere, making the extra charge for this package well worth it. It was also nice to hit the club room and relax a bit after a day of sightseeing and walking. Another great feature of this hotel is the rooftop pool - but note that the water isn't heated and it was cold!!! On a side note which has nothing to do with the hotel itself, my husband did get his wallet lifted on the Metro. Fortunately nothing of much consequence was lost, but it's something to be aware of - Spain is famous for the talents of their pickpockets.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried because of the low cost but as it turned out the Emperador Htoel us a little gem! My wife and teenage daughter were greeted very warmly and found the service to be just wonderful! We were there for two nights and really loved the size of the rooms (I guess the top floor rooms are bigger). Location is perfect too, just a short walk to everything fun! The staff was just terrific and made us feel like were were staying at a good friends home. It is the perfect hotel for a couple traveling with a teenage daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive - the only highlight was the pool. Great pool with ice cold water to cool off. The rest of the stay was horrible! Rooms were ok to small in size and the bed was the smallest twin I've ever seen, not even sure it was a mattress under there. The air-conditioning was loud and had trouble working. The staff was rude and not very knowledgeable of anything. Couldn't get them to recommend a restaurant other than their own - I speak Spanish. The night manager said my room was the smallest in the hotel and was very surprised I was given it at my rate. She had no rooms available that night but made a notation to have me move first thing in the morning. The morning staff refused to - citing they know nothing about moving me. When I approached the night manager when she came back on duty - again she made a big sign and a notation in her book for the morning staff - again the morning staff wouldn't do anything. Beware of the shuttle to the airport - the staff told me it was 19 Euros', put it in writing and made the reservation - when the shuttle dropped me off they said 36 Euros. It took 1/2 hour to convince them. Now most IMPORTANT - beware of the neighborhood. Although it is in the heart of it all, walking distance to the Sol and Mayor, crime is everywhere. I was robbed in the first hour I was there. I have been going to Europe for over 25 years including backing around Africa, its bad. When the hotel has an armed guard at the door, it should tell you something. Would recommend staying over in the neighborhood of the Westin or Prado - much safer. Pickpockets are VERY good in Heurta and Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect once we upgraded!”
Reviews.Author: jackste
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel - On arrival we were impressed - big, grand reception, friendly staff & great location. We were allocated a standard room on the 4th floor. It was a big, spacious, clean room but it was so old fashioned and dark - it had a chocolate brown bathroon suite with a tiny bath and the view was....well, a wall!! We asked to be moved but there was nothing except a Jnr Suite available which we upgraded to at considerable cost. We considered it to be well worth it, the suite was fantastic with great views onto the Gran Via, a huge bed & bath etc,etc!! The breakfast was excellent - absolutely no complaints (something for everyone). The swimming pool and sunbathing terrace are what makes this hotel special and the best place to stay in Madrid, plenty of sunbeds, a snack bar, a big pool with a lifeguard on duty at all times. After a morning sightseeing/shopping its absolutely great to go back and chill out - I felt it provided the best of both worlds! If we were to go back to Madrid I would definately return to this hotel. However, I dont think I'd be enthusing quite so much if I had stayed in the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative revies”
Reviews.Author: Suki Pickering
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for a short weekend break and we were so impressed with the hotel and i can't believe the bad reviews Its lovely - has an atrium running through it and they've really made best use of the space. Reception was very friendly and helpful - some could do with smiling more! the main hotel manager was so sweet. You can even help yourself to a glass of cava and water when you go past! The rooms were just perfect - quite small bed area but you only need to sleep! We had a lovely balcony overlooking Gran Via which was great. Best bits - the free mini bar (all soft drinks and beer) - what a complete result!! never had that before.! AND the reclining beds - could not believe this fab addition - we couldn't stop gloating in our excitement for ages !!! Breakfast was really great- lots of cold meats, cheeses, fruit, pastries galore and you could have eggs if you wished. And even a glass of Cava again! Only small gripe was not having any juicy tomatoes!! re: Madrid -the location is just perfect to walk to the main city areas - and Gran Via is the main shopping area - we were quite disappointed with shopping but still managed to spend!! Go to Cheuca - which is a small walk from hotel - its the gay scene but has the coolest bars and restaurants Madrid great for a weekend break - there's no pressure to sightseeing if you just want to relax and tour buses are best way to get around. Food and drink - you can't fault and really really reasonable prices. Metro is also very cheap - 1 euro to get to airport!!! Go to Retiro Park too - beautiful on a Sunday. Beware that a lot of store shut on Sundays. Also if your spanish is non existence take a translation book - most people don't or chose not to speak English!! Would definitely go back to hotel and Madrid again Suki

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels in Europe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. The location is good, right in the middle of the City Center. Our room on the first floor was above the Kitchen. There was constant noise all night long. There was no view except piping and a dirty alley. The staff was pleasant. When we arrived there was no A/C in the room. The staff agreed to move us to the 3rd. Floor, but there was no hot water. We moved back to the 1st Floor and there was no hot water there either. The engineer came to the room and told us that we had to run the water for 10-20 minutes and it would become hot, which it did. There was a sticker on the wall telling us to conserve water. The rooms are spacious but the furniture is old and the wall paper on the walls is peeling off. Frankly, this was probably the worst hotel that we have stayed at in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: kangaroo5050
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends last summer and it was a lovely experience. The rooms are lush and spacious, plenty of amenities and the breakfasts are great as well. While at times we had a bit of difficulty communicating in English with some of the staff, still they were always friendly and gracious. Across the board this is a winner in terms of location, comfort and especially price (you definitely get your money's worth). I suggest booking it directly through the hotel, they have a great website and are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Emperador!”
Reviews.Author: anothersunnyday
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at the Emperador for 5 days in February to celebrate Valentines day. After reading the reviews on here a few days before, I was slightly worried, I needn't have been though because the hotel was gorgeous! We stayed on the 4th floor facing onto the Gran Via, we'd heard this was extremely noisy but we found it very quiet! (Unless you open the balcony doors, which did make it rather noisy.) Our room was lovely, not the most modern decorating but it was clean & comfortable, the bathroom was really nice too. Breakfast was great, very good selection of cereals, fruit, sliced meats, Spanish omelette, different breads & drinks. (Though the scrambled eggs were 'slightly' runny) The staff at the hotel were so helpful, they hailed taxis for us, gave us advice on where to eat, booked tables for us, generally a great help. It's a shame the pool wasn't open when we stayed but we still had an amazing time. The location of the hotel is great, you can walk to the Puerto Del Sol in 5/10mins, get a metro right outside the hotel or hop on a (red route) tour bus also right outside! We bought a 2 day pass for the tour buses which was great as we got to see alot of the city, we didn't get a metro till the very last day but wish we'd got one sooner as it's only 1euro per journey, the 2 day bus tour was 19euro each but we did get to see alot more. Madrid itself has so much to offer, lovely sights, brilliant places to eat & fantastic people. We could only speak about 3 words in Spanish when we went but everyone was so helpful & nearly all the restaurant have menus in English & if they didn't they tried their best to translate the whole menu for you! A word of advice about the museums, check when they're open before you set off, we went to the Prado, Reina Sofía & the Thyssen-Bornemisza on I think it was Monday, only to realise all the museums are shut on Mondays! Also lots of places are free on certain days, like the Temple De Debod was free on Sundays, very nice to get pictures there but not worth paying unless you can read Spanish. The Atocha train station is worth a visit & the Retiro gardens are beautiful, the Kio towers are really cool too but quite a trek out of the city. Anyway, I’d definitely recommend this hotel & Madrid is fantastic, so get your holiday booked now!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet_Potter
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed in this hotel for a long weekend and it was fantastic. The location couldn't be any better, right on the Gran Via which is one of Madrid's main shopping areas. The bedroom was lovely, although think we were in a smoking room even though we requested a non smoking (however we did book very last minute). Marble bathroom with all the little extras and a well stocked mini bar! Breakfast was everything you needed to prepare for a full day of shopping! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, but otherwise...”
Reviews.Author: SonOfBruin2
Reviews.Content: Just as reviewers have already stated, the pool is the selling point of this hotel, and deservedly so. During our stay it was about 100 degrees in Madrid, so the surprisingly/refreshingly cool pool made the stay worth it. However, if it is not going to be hot during your stay, I would suggest staying somewhere else. My family and I stayed for three nights in two double club-level rooms. The access to the club room was worth it -- we went through about eight free bottles of water daily, and in the evenings the option was there to stop by for a complimentary cocktail or beer. One room had a king bed and the other two twins. All the room problems stemmed from the twin room. For starters, the chandelier in the room (the primary source of light) was broken so the room was darker than the king room, and no attempts were made to fix the problem. More importantly, the a/c was not functioning properly. Someone came to "fix" it twice, but there was no major improvement. While the fan appeared to blow a little stronger with every mechanic visit, the unit was not de-humidifying the air, giving the room a somewhat damp feel. Our second day we were offered a different room on the same floor (7), but that room was even hotter than the original. The following day we were offered a room on the eighth floor which was a major improvement. It was slightly bigger with a sitting area, and it had working a/c.
