To our surprise, that room was stocked with Hermes brand toiletries because it was a club level room, but our rooms on the seventh floor (club level) had standard toiletries. We complained to the front desk and the seventh floor maid begrudgingly handed over the premium stuff (!). In general the rooms and bathrooms were at least clean. The lobby was depressing, though. The floral arrangement was old by the time we arrived, and they let it continue to wilt until our last night. The ceiling desperately needs a coat of paint or two to hide the permanent shadows/burns from the lights. The "gym" is a joke. Service was polite but hapless and clueless. We asked if there was a restaurant nearby that served pollo asado, and all they could come up with was KFC. We walked a block from our hotel and found three places that served pollo asado -- sad. If there were no swimming pool/sun deck, this would be an okay hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorenzo72
Reviews.Content: I've stayed with some friends at Emperador Hotel for 4 nights in August 2005. Its location is perfect for visiting all major spots in Madrid. We almost never took metro because the hotel is really close to everything. Rooms are quite small and nothing special, but they are clean and comfortable. The pool on the roof is a great plus: very nice, great views and towels are provided for free to hotel guests. I would surely go back to Emperador if going to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely wall!”
Reviews.Author: Avendanio
Reviews.Content: Last weekend to celebrate our anniversary (we live in Madrid and for various reasons couldn't leave the city) so we reserved a room at the Hotel Emperador, which has a lovely rooftop swimming pool. Unfortunately, the only view the room had was of a brick wall about 10 feet away. We asked for a room with a better view, and the concierge was very nice about it, but all he could come up with was one that looked onto an interior patio with hoses and water running down the wall. We thanked him and left. So although no complaints about the hotel service or the room itself, this is just to let you know that despite being a four star hotel, there are rooms that look straight out onto a wall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Emperador”
Reviews.Author: RhosdduRed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Emperador for 5 nights in June 2005. As it was my wife's birthday, we made requests via both Expedia and the hotel's own website. Unfortunately, when we arrived they had no record of either. Oh hum. Thankfully, they did change our room fron one on the 3rd floor to one on the 6th which suited us. The hotel is situated right on an intersection on Grand Via and so there was a fair amount of traffic noise in our room. However, it did have secondary double glazing which meant that once the two sets of balcony doors were shut, most of the sounds were blocked out. The only exception was the police / ambulance / fire engine sirens which seemed to go past at regular intervals. I can honestly say that this did not spoil our stay and my wife was really pleased to be able to open the balcony doors and get some fresh air. The room itself was a moderate size but was very confortable. The bathroom was quite big and there was constant hot water. We've stayed in a number of hotels around the world and can honestly say that this was one of the cleanest hotels we have ever stayed in. The maid service was excellent. Location wise, it is less than a 5 minute walk to the main shopping thoroughfare and Plaza Mayor, Plaza Santa Ana and the Royal Palace were within 10 minutes. The main museums were a bit further but they are a comfortable walk on a nice day. There is a tube station right by the hotel if you don't fancy the walk. Watch out for pickpockets though especially by Plaza Mayor as my wife had her purse opened whilst we were walking along. Watch out for pickpockets posing with maps and pretending to be lost. It's quite a common scam apparently. We'd certainly stay at the Emperador again.

Reviews.Title: “I just expected more...”
Reviews.Author: merrm
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Madrid staying at the Emperador. It's a lovely hotel but is just slightly let down overall. Our room was a suite but was twin despite booking a double and there was nothing else left, but there was no apology forthcoming. the airconditioning was severely lacking, the safe didn't work, the pay TV didn't work and the staff were distinctly lacking in enthusiasm. The broken curtain rail was however fixed immediately. I am not someone who likes to complain, but while the hotel was nice enough I had expected a higher level of service from a 4*. The pool however is glorious, but as the public can pay to use it, the first day was completely packed which seems very unfair when you are actually staying at the hotel. Our observations of the staff however did extend to most spanish staff we encountered. Having holidayed in Italy, the Spanish are a pale comparison when it comes to tourism. I can't say that I will bother going back to Spain, but that is just my preference, I know most people love Spain!

Reviews.Title: “great position, fab pool”
Reviews.Author: jolondon123
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel right on the Gran Via in the heart of central Madrid was its main strength. Also, all the main sites were walkable within half an hour, and the shops and bars were right nearby. The roof pool was a haven in a busy and hectic city, though the downside was it didn't open until 11am and closed at 9pm which was before the sunset so no photo opportunities to be had over the rooftops of Madrid. Though this was rated a 4* hotel I think the rooms and breakfast were really 3* quality, the whole place was a bit "tired". The rooms face either a wall or the main street. I swapped from a wall facing room to a street facing room so saw two bathrooms, both of which could have done with updating, and beds in both rooms needed new springs. Though the hotel boasts cable TV they only offer CNN or BBC World in English unless you pay about 10Euros per day for film channels. If you're travelling alone, as I was, this hotel is great for accessibility. Be sure to get a good deal though as in my opinion it's not worth 4* prices as advertisied in the hotel - the internet was a great place to book at cheaper prices.

Reviews.Title: “love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Madrid almost every summer for the past 10 years. I am very familiar with the city and with the hotel standards in Spain and in Europe. I keep on going back to the Emperador because of the fact that it has an EXCEPTIONAL location in the city. You can walk to the Plaza Mayor, to La Plaza de Espana, to La Puerta del Sol, as well as to major shopping / pedestrain areas. In addition to the location the hotel itself is quite nice. The breakfast is of superior quality / selection, the staff is very helpful, the rooms are spacious, etc. Another very important factor is the cost - the Emperador is VERY reasonably priced in relation to its level of luxury and location in the city. I would recommend this hotel with my eyes closed - you will love it! I am going again in February of this year and I was just there this past June!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop pools rule!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two selling points that go hand in hand with each other, the rooftop pool and terrace and the unequalled views of the city of Madrid. Our party of 16 people (all work Colleagues!) set about taking over the area for two days, the service was great and the prices were good too. The rooms varied in quality though, some members of the party had very spacious corner rooms, very nicely decorated in pale pastel colours, whilst other rooms were rather small with very old fashioned fixtures and fittings. The staff were really friendly and the hotel itself was really smart. All in all a good time was had by all, great location in a fantastic city.
